Bone Soldier

3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero

Champion
Graveyard Slash
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Graveyard Stumble
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Graveyard Slash is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable in the Front 3 Positions that deals Decent Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Ranks.
Graveyard Stumble is a Very Inaccurate Single Target Repositioning Attack wsable from Position 4 that deals Low Damage while Moving the Bone Soldier Forward.
Overall Analysis
The Bone Soldier is a relatively Low HP Frontline Enemy with some Prot that deals Damage using Graveyard Slash.

This Enemy starts every Combat with 2 Turns of Stealth from Veteran Difficulty Onward.

The Bone Soldier isn't much of a threat although Graveyard Slash can deal quite a lot of Damage if it Crits.

Therefore, you will probably want to focus on the more threatening Enemies accompanying the Bone Soldier.

You can use Stuns to shut the Bone Soldier down for a turn or just kill it outright thanks to the Bone Soldier having relatively Low HP.

Moving the Bone Soldier to Position 4 is another way to shut it down since the Bone Soldier will only be able to use Graveyard Stumble, a Weak Repositioning Attack.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Bone Defender
Ruins
Cooldowns
Foul Warding - 2 rd Cooldown

5.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to be Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Dead Weight
1.0 Base Chance to be used if there are 2+ Non Stunned Heroes
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Move Resist Non Stunned Hero
80% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Move Resist
Clumsy Axeblade
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Foul Warding
2.0 Base Chance unless 2+ Guarded Monsters
Skill Breakdown
Axeblade is a Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Mediocre Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions.

This Attack gains the ability to inflict a - Stun and Move Resist Debuff to the Target Hero from Veteran Difficulty, synergizing with Dead Weight.

Clumsy Axeblade is a Very Inaccurate Single Target Repositioning Attack used in the Back 2 Positions that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions while Moving the Bone Defender Forward.

Dead Weight is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks.

This Attack can Stun the Target Hero while also Knocking them Back, and is used to disrupt your Frontline Heroes.

Foul Warding is a Support Skill used by the Bone Defender to Guard an Ally while also Buffing its own Prot so it take more hits.
Overall Analysis
The Bone Defender is a sturdy frontliner with a Decent HP Pool and High Prot that can disrupt your Heroes with Dead Weight and deal some Damage using Axeblade.

The Bone Defender gains the ability to Guard its Allies using Foul Warding from Veteran Difficulty Onward.

The Bone Defender is of no real threat due to its Attacks not dealing much Damage, which is why you should be dealing with the bigger threats accompanying the Bone Defender first.

Stuns can be very effective for shutting down the Bone Defender for a turn while breaking its Guard.

In addition, Moving the Bone Defender to the Back 2 Positions can effectively Shut down the Bone Defender since it will only be able to use Clumsy Axeblade, a Weak Repositioning Attack.

Overall Threat Level: Low

Bone Arbalist
Ruins
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Quarrel
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Bayonet Jab
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Quarrel
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Bayonet Jab
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
Quarrel
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Bayonet Jab
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Quarrel is a Decently Accurate High Crit Chance Single Target Attack usable from the Back 2 Positions that deals Decent Damage to a Hero in the Back 3 Ranks.

This Attack benefit from a Damage Bonus when Targetting Marked Heroes (+25% on Apprentice // +50% from Veteran Onwards)

Bayonet Jab is a Single Target Repositioning Attack used from the Front 2 Positions which deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions while Moving the Bone Arbalist Back.
Overall Analysis
The Bone Arbalist is a Backline Enemy with Decent Speed and HP that uses Quarrel to deal Damage to your Heroes.

Quarrel can pack a punch with its Decent Damage and High Crit Chance, making it a good idea to get rid of or shut down the Bone Arbalist.

You can easily shut down the Bone Arbalist by Moving it to the Front 2 Positions where it can only use Bayonet Jab, a weak Repositioning Attack. Stuns are also a good way to shut down the Bone Arbalist for a turn.

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Bone Courtier
Ruins
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Tempting Goblet
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
50% Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
Knife in the Dark
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Tempting Goblet
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
66.7% Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
Knife in the Dark
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
Tempting Goblet
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
75% Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
Knife in the Dark
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Tempting Goblet is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals Low HP Damage and a hefty amount of Stress Damage to a Hero in any Position.
Knife in the Dark is a Low Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions which deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions.
Overall Analysis
The Bone Courtier is a Low HP Backline Enemy with High Dodge and Speed that uses Tempting Goblet to inflict Stress to your Heroes.

Due to the hefty Amount of Stress the Bone Courtier can inflict, it is a good idea to get rid of it quickly.

You can try to Move the Bone Courtier to Position 1 where it can only use Knife in the Dark, a weak Attack.

Otherwise, Using a Hero with High Speed to outspeed and Stun or Kill the Bone Courtier can be a good option.

Champion Level Bone Courtier Enemies have a roughly 4.5% Chance to drop the Tempting Goblet Trinket

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Bone Spearman
Ruins
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Veteran
Impale
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Spear Thrust
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Champion
Impale
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Spear Thrust
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Spear Thrust is a Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Decently High Damage alongside inflicting Knockback.
Impale is a Decently Accurate High Crit Chance AoE Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Damage to all 4 Heroes.
Overall Analysis
The Bone Spearman is an Enemy with Decent HP that deals hefty amounts of Damage using Spear Thrust and Impale.

The main threat the Bone Spearman poses is Impale, which can be spammed every turn if the Bone Spearman is at the Front 2 Positions, dealing Damage to all 4 of your Heroes.

Due to this, it is advised to make sure the Bone Spearman stays in the Back 2 Positions where it can only use Spear Thrust, a relatively less threatening Attack.

Stuns can also be effective in shutting down the Bone Spearman for a turn, giving your Heroes more time to get rid of it or any other threats.

Overall Threat Level: High

Bone Captain
Ruins
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Veteran
Crushing Blow
1.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Chance to be used as First Action
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Ground Pound
1.0 Base Chance to be used
5.0 Base Chance to be used as Second Action
Champion
Crushing Blow
2.0 Base Chance to be used
7.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Ground Pound
1.0 Base Chance to be used
5.0 Base Chance to be used as Second Action
Skill Breakdown
Crushing Blow is a Decently Accurate High Crit Chance Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Very High Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks.

This Attack also inflicts a - Stun Resist Debuff to the Target Hero, helping Enemies such as the Bone Defender and itself land their Stuns.

Ground Pound is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from any Position that inflicts Damage to all 4 Heroes alongside a relatively Weak Stun.
Overall Analysis
The Bone Captain is a Decently High HP Size 2 Enemy with High Prot that uses Crushing Blow to deal a Large Amount of Damage to a Hero or Ground Pound to Stun your Heroes.

The Bone Captain is a threatening Enemy, being able to deal Very High Damage to your Front Rank Heroes and cause disruption through Stuns.

Even so, due to the Bone Captain being difficult to eliminate quickly, it is usually a better call to deal with the Enemies accompanying the Bone Captain.

Stuns and Debuffs are effective for shutting down the Bone Captain and limiting its Damage Output while dealing with the Bone Captain or the Enemies accompanying it.

Crushing Blow only being able to Target Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks can be taken advantage of by having Heroes with High Prot or Dodge in the Front Ranks to tank the hits.

Overall Threat Level: High
Bone Bearer
Ruins
Champion
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Defend the Icon
3.0 Base Chance to be Used
Wicked Surge
1.0 Base Chance to be Used
Unholy Rally
Requires Ally Corpse
Skill Breakdown
Wicked Surge is a Support Skill used by the Bone Bearer to Buff an Ally's Damage and Accuracy greatly, making them much more of a threat.

Defend the Icon is a Single Target Repositioning Attack used from the Front 2 Positions that deals Mediocre Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions while Moving the Bone Bearer Back.

Unholy Rally is an Auto Action that is performed by the Bone Bearer at the end of a round if any Corpses of its Allies are Present.

This Skill is used to Revive a Fallen Monster, replenishing it to Full HP and removing any Bleed or Blight applied to the Corpse.

It should be noted that this Skill can only revive 1 Enemy at a time.

Alongside being able to use these Skills, the Bone Bearer also gives all of its Allies a + 25% Damage Buff just by existing.
Overall Analysis
The Bone Bearer is a Backline Enemy with High HP, Speed, and Dodge on top of some Prot and a Sky High Stun Resist Stat that uses its Skills to greatly Buff its Allies using Wicked Surge and is able to Revive them using Unholy Rally.

The many Buffs the Bone Bearer gives its Allies makes it a significant threat, not to mention its ability to Revive its fallen Allies.

You want to make sure there are no Enemy Corpses remaining at the end of a round if the Bone Bearer is present so Unholy Rally Cannot be used.

When dealing with the Bone Bearer, you can either try to eliminate all Enemies accompanying the Bone Bearer first or attempt to focus down the Bone Bearer itself.

In either case, you can somewhat hinder the Bone Bearer by pulling it to the Front Ranks, where it is very likely to use Defend the Icon in order to return to the Back Ranks.

Overall Threat Level: High

Fungal Scratcher
Weald
All Difficulties
Rend the Marked
100.0 Base Chance to be used if Marked Hero in Front Ranks
Targetting Desire
Always Targets Marked Hero
Groping Swipe
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Harmless Swipe
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Skill Breakdown
Groping Swipe is a Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Mediocre Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks, also inflicting Blight on Veteran Difficulty Onward.

Rend the Marked is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Mediocre Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks alongside benefitting from a +50% Damage Buff when Targetting Marked Heroes.

Harmless Swipe is a Very Inaccurate Single Target Repositioning Attack used from the Back 2 Positions that deals Low Damage while Moving the Fungal Scratcher Forward.
Overall Analysis
The Fungal Scratcher is a durable Frontline Enemy with a Decent HP Pool and High Prot that uses Groping Swipe and Rend the Marked to deal Damage to your Front Rank Heroes.

Since the Fungal Scratcher doesn't deal much Direct Hp Damage, it can be preferrable to take hits from Rend the Marked rather than take Blight Damage from Groping Swipe.

This can be achieved by having a Hero in the Front 2 Positions use Skills such as Bulwark of Faith to Mark themselves while boosting their Prot to tank Attacks from the Fungal Scratcher.

The Fungal Scratcher can be shut down easily by using Stuns or Moving it to the Back 2 Ranks where it can only use Harmless Swipe.

Due to the Fungal Scratcher being quite durable and it posing little threat to your Heroes, you should be getting rid of all of the other threats accompanying the Fungal Scratcher before trying to kill it.

Overall Threat Level: Low
Fungal Artillery
Weald
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Mark Prey
Not used if 3+ Heroes are Marked
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Blight Resist
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
25% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Blight Resist
Rain of Blight
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Escape Cloud
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Mark Prey
Not used if 3+ Heroes are Marked
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Blight Resist
60% Chance to Target Marked Hero
20% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Blight Resist
Rain of Blight
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Escape Cloud
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
All Skills
Mark Prey
Not used if 3+ Heroes are Marked
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Blight Resist
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
16.5% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Blight Resist
Rain of Blight
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Escape Cloud
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Mark Prey is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from the Back 2 Positions that deals Minimal Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions alongside Marking them.

This Attack also inflicts a - Dodge Debuff to the Target Hero, helping Enemies that prioritize Targetting Marked Targets focus down the Marked Hero.

Rain of Blight is a High Accuracy AoE Attack usable from the Back 2 Positions that deals Minimal Damage to both Heroes in the Back 2 Positions alongside inflicting Blight.

This Attack also has a hefty 15% Chance to Disease Heroes which can prove to be troublesome.

Escape Cloud is a High Accuracy AoE Attack with minimal Damage used from the Front 2 Positions that deals Minimal Damage and inflicts Blight to both Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks while Moving the Fungal Artillery to the Back Ranks.
Overall Analysis
The Fungal Artillery is a Backline Enemy with some Prot that uses Mark Prey to Mark your Heroes alongside inflicting Blight with Rain of Blight and Escape Cloud.

The Fungal Artillery itself isn't all that threatening outside of Rain of Blight having a hefty 15% Disease application Chance.

Unlike many other Backline Enemies, Moving the Fungal Artillery to the Front Ranks isn't a very good idea due to Escape Cloud having a nasty habit of Critting your Heroes.

On the other hand, it can sometimes be worth taking the hit from Escape Cloud to prevent the usage of Mark Prey or Rain of Blight.

That being said Moving the Fungal Artillery to the Front 2 Ranks while Stunned can be a good call, stranding it in the Front Positions where it can be more easily dispatched.

This can be achieved by using Skills such as Flashbang or Disorienting Blast or Moving the Fungal Artillery Forwards with one Hero and Stunning it with another.

Although the Fungal Artillery is usually not much of a threat, due to it being able to use Mark Prey to help its Allies land their Attacks and the Fungal Artillery being able to Disease your Heroes, it can be a good call to get rid of them early.

Overall Threat Level: Medium
Rabid Gnasher
Weald
Hamlet
Rabid Rush
Apprentice
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Veteran // Champion
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Rabid Rush is a Decently Accurate High Crit Chance Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Very Low Damage alongside inflicting Bleed while Moving the Rabid Gnasher Forward.
This Attack also has a 10% Chance to inflict the Rabies Disease to the Target Hero, which can be troublesome due to it lowering the Hero's Accuracy.
Overall Analysis
The Rabid Gnasher is a Low HP Enemy with High Speed and Dodge that inflicts Bleed and Disease using Rabid Rush.

Due to the Rabid Gnasher having High Dodge, it can be a problem early on when you have minimal methods of boosting the Accuracy of your Heroes.

Although the Rabid Gnasher poses little threat in terms of Damage, the Disease it can spread alongside Rabid Rush having a High Crit Chance can be troublesome, making it a good call to eliminate them early.

Stuns are useful for shutting down the Rabid Gnasher for a turn, and you can take advantage of the Rabid Gnasher having Low HP and try to kill them outright.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low
Ectoplasm
Weald
All Difficulties
Slime
4.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Cytokinesis
2.0 Base Chance to be used if 1+ Empty Enemy Position Present
(Corpses Count as Empty Positions)
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Ectoplasmic Profusion
1.0 Base Chance to be used if 2+ Empty Enemy Position Present
(Corpses Count as Empty Positions)
Skill Breakdown
Slime is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Mediocre Damage.

This Attack gains the ability to inflict a Minor - Speed Debuff to the Target Hero from Veteran Difficulty Onwards.

Cytokinesis is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals minimal Damage.

This Attack is only usable by the Ectoplasm if 1 or more Enemy Positions are Empty or filled with Corpses.

An Ectoplasm Enemy is Summoned at Position 1 regardless of whether the Attack hits or not.

Ectoplasmic Profusion is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from all Positions that deals Very Low HP Damage and some Stress Damage to all 4 of your Heroes.

This Attack is only usable by the Ectoplasm if 2 or more Enemy Positions are Empty or filled with Corpses.

A Large Ectoplasm is Summoned at Position 1 regardless of whether the Attack hits or not.
Overall Analysis
The Ectoplasm is a Low HP Enemy with High Overall Resists that uses attacks such as Cytokinesis and Ectoplasmic Profusion to prolong the Battle and wear your Heroes down.

It should be a priority to prevent the Ectoplasm from using Ectoplasmic Profusion due to it often unecessarily prolonging the Battle.

A good way to achieve this is to, try to get all Ectoplasm Enemies to Low HP with your Attacks so that your Heroes can easily dispatch them all in quick succession.

Due to the Ectoplasm having High Resists but Low HP, Direct Damage Attacks are best for getting rid of them easily.

Overall Threat Level: Low
Large Ectoplasm
Weald
All Difficulties
Big Slime
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
2.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Cytokinesis
1.0 Base Chance to be used if 1+ Empty Enemy Position Present
(Corpses Count as Empty Positions)
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
2.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Slime Smack
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Big Slime is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Decent Damage.

This Attack gains the ability to inflict a Minor - Speed Debuff to the Target Hero from Veteran Difficulty Onwards.

Cytokinesis is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals minimal Damage.

This Attack is only usable by the Large Ectoplasm if 1 or more Enemy Positions are Empty or filled with Corpses.

Slime Smack is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from any Position that deals Low Damage to both Heroes in the Front 2 Positions alongside a relatively Weak Stun.
Overall Analysis
The Large Ectoplasm is a Size 2 Enemy with some Prot and High Overall Resists that can disrupt your Heroes using Slime Smack or use Cytokinesis to Summon additional Ectoplasm Enemies.

The Large Ectoplasm lacks much Damage output with it only being able to deal Decent Damage with Slime Smack, making it generally a non threat.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low
Crone
Weald
Cooldowns
Curse of Vulnerability - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Veteran
Curse of Vulnerability
Not used if 2+ Heroes are Marked
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Fetid Censer
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Embrace the Dark
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
Curse of Vulnerability
Not used if 2+ Heroes are Marked
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
7.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Fetid Censer
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Embrace the Dark
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Curse of Vulnerability is a Decently Accurate Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal Damage to 1 or 2 Heroes alongside Marking them.

This Attack also inflicts a hefty - Dodge and - Accuracy Debuff to the Heroes, helping Enemies that prioritize Targetting Marked Targets focus down the Marked Hero.

Fetid Censer is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Very Low HP Damage and some Stress Damage to both Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks alongside inflicting Blight.

This Attack also has a Chance to Disease Heroes (7% on Veteran // 9% on Champion) which can prove to be troublesome.

Embrace the Dark is a Decently Accurate Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Stress Damage to 1 or 2 Heroes alongside Lowering the Light Level.
Overall Analysis
The Crone is a Backline Enemy with High Speed and Dodge which deals Stress Damage with its Attacks alongside Debuffing and Marking Heroes.

This Enemy always starts every Combat with 2 turns of Stealth, making them harder to eliminate quickly.

Unlike many other Backline Enemies, Moving the Crone to the Front Ranks isn't a very good idea due to Fetid Censer dealing Stress Damage, inflicting Blight, and most importantly being able to Disease your Front Rank Heroes.

Due to the Crone not being too much of a threat alongside its Stealth making it harder to eliminate, it can be better to ignore it entirely and deal with the other threats accompanying the Crone.

That being said, you should get rid of the Crone early on if you have the tools to eliminate it quickly, stopping the Crone from Marking or dealing Stress to your Heroes

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Unclean Giant
Weald
Cooldowns
Confusion Spores - 2 rd Cooldown
Poison Spores - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Veteran
Treebranch Smackdown
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Poison Spores
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with lowest HP %
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
25% Chance to Target Hero with lowest HP %
Confusion Spores
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
4.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Champion
Treebranch Smackdown
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Poison Spores
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with lowest HP %
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
25% Chance to Target Hero with lowest HP %
Confusion Spores
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
5.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Skill Breakdown
Treebranch Smackdown is a Single Target Attack usable from any Position with a Decent Crit Chance that deals Extremely High Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions alongside Knocking them Back.

Confusion Spores is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from any Position that deals Minimal Damage to all 4 of your Heroes, Shuffling them and causing major disruption.

This Attack also inflicts a - Accuracy Debuff to your Heroes and has a High Chance to used as the Unclean Giant's First Action.

Poison Spores is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal Damage to a Hero alongside inflicting Blight.

This Attack has a 25% Chance to Target the Hero with the lowest HP %, likely so it could be used to finish off a Hero on Death's Door.
Overall Analysis
The Unclean Giant is an Extremely High HP Size 2 Enemy that can deal Extremely High Damage with Treebrach Smackdown and cause major disruption using Confusion Spores.

Due to the Unclean Giant posing a Huge threat thanks to Treebranch Smackdown, it can be a good call to focus it down first before it can do serious Damage.

If you are confident you can keep the Unclean Giant at bay using Debuffs and/or Stuns, it can be a good idea to get rid of the Enemies accompanying the Unclean Giant since it cannot threaten to kill a Hero if by itself.

In any case, Stuns and Debuffs are very useful for keeping the Unclean Giant in check by limiting its damage output.

Treebranch Smackdown only being able to Target Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks can be taken advantage of by having Heroes with High Prot or Dodge in the Front Ranks to tank the hits.

Overall Threat Level: High

Hateful Virago
Weald
Champion
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Ruinous Hex
4.0 Base Chance to be used if 2+ Non Marked Heroes Present
Putrefying Breath
2.0 Base Chance to be used
From Death Comes Life
Requires Ally Corpse
Skill Breakdown
Ruinous Hex is an Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements which deals Low Damage to 1 or 2 Heroes alongside Marking them.

This Attack inflicts a hefty Dodge and Accuracy Debuff to the Target Hero Hero on top of Marking them, helping the many Enemies who have a bias towards Targetting Marked Heroes or have a Bonus vs Marked Targets focus down the Marked Hero.

Putrefying Breath is a Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals Decent Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Positions alongside inflicting a relatively Weak Blight and causing Knockback.

From Death Comes Life is an Auto Action that is performed by the Hateful Virago at the end of a round if any Enemy Corpses are Present.

This Skill is used to consume the Corpse and Summon a Necrotic Fungus which disables all Healing Skills for your Heroes.
Overall Analysis
The Hateful Virago is a High HP Backline Enemy with High Speed and Dodge alongside overall High Resists across the board, notable ones being its Very High Stun Resist Stat.

The Virago can Mark and Debuff your Heroes using Ruinous Hex, deal Decent Damage using Putrefying Breath, or Summon a Necrotic Fungus using From Death Comes Life to deny your Heroes from being able to use any Healing Skills.

The Virago doesn't pose much of a threat by itself, dealing middling at best Damage with its Attacks.

However, it can become a great threat if you allow there to be an Enemy Corpse at the end of the round, in which case the Virago will automatically use From Death Comes Life and consume the Corpse to Summon a Necrotic Fungus Enemy which Disables all Healing Skills for your Heroes.

It is preferrable to eliminate the Hateful Virago quickly to stop this from happening, which is most easily done using Mark Based Heroes to burst the Hateful Virago down.

In addition, although Moving the Virago to the Front Ranks won't hinder it at all, it can be a good idea to do so if it helps your Damage Dealers get rid of the Hateful Virago more easily.

Since From Death Comes Life can only be used if there is an Enemy Corpse present, simply making sure there are none present at the end of a round will prevent the Skill from being used.

Overall Threat Level: High

Necrotic Fungus
Weald
Overall Analysis
The Necrotic Fungus can be encountered when the Hateful Virago uses From Death Comes Life to Summon it.

It has no actions and cannot directly threaten your Heroes but disables all Healing Skills by existing, which can prove to be lethal.

It is usually better to get rid of it quickly although it may more preferrable to deal with the Hateful Virago and the other Enemies first if your Heroes aren't in a dire need for Healing.

Overall Threat Level: High
Swine Chopper
Warrens

40% Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
Ball and Chain

Targetting Desire

Veteran
Butcher Cut
