3.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
2.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
33.3% Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
Ball and Chain
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
4.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Highest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
50% Chance to Target Highest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
Champion
Butcher Cut
2.0 Base Chance to be used.
3.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
16.5% Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
Ball and Chain
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
4.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Highest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Highest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
Skill Breakdown
Butcher Cut is a Decently Accurate Decently High Crit Chance Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Decent Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Positions alongside inflicting Bleed.

This Attack gains a nasty - Healing Received Debuff (-33% on Veteran // -50% on Champion) from Veteran Difficulty onward that can prove to be very Troublesome.

Ball and Chain is a Decently Accurate Decently High Crit Chance Single Target Attack usable from all Positions that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Back 2 Positions.

This Attack can Stun a Hero whilst also causing Knockback.
Overall Analysis
The Swine Chopper is a Decently High HP Enemy with Prot that can use its Attacks to inflict Bleeds or cause disruption.

The Swine Chopper is a genuine threat thanks to its decent Damage Dealing capabilities alongside the - Healing Received Debuff Butcher Cut can inflict from Veteran Difficulty especially when paired with the many High Damage threats that are Present within the Warrens.

However, due to the Swine Chopper being quite difficult to get rid of quickly, it is usually a good idea to use Stuns to keep the Swine Chopper in check while your Heroes deal with the other threatening Enemies accompanying the Swine Chopper.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High
Swine Drummer
Warrens
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Drums of Doom
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Drums of Debilitation
1.0 Base Chance to be used.
4.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action.
Veteran
Drums of Doom
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Drums of Debilitation
Not used if 3+ Heroes are Marked
1.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Champion
Drums of Doom
4.0 Base Chance to be used
Drums of Debilitation
Not used if 3+ Heroes are Marked
1.0 Base Chance to be used
9.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Skill Breakdown
Drums of Debilitation is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal Damage to the Target Hero.

This Attack Marks a Hero alongside Debuffing their Dodge, helping the many Enemies who have a bias towards Targetting Marked Heroes or have a Bonus vs Marked Targets focus down the Marked Hero.

Drums of Doom is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from any Position that deals Minimal HP Damage and Minor Stress Damage to all 4 Heroes.
Overall Analysis
The Swine Drummer is a Backline Enemy with High Speed that Inflicts Stress to your entire Party with Drums of Doom and Marks Heroes using Drums of Debilitation.

Although the Swine Drummer by itself is of no real threat, it can set up Marks for other Enemies to take advantage of.

Due to this, you want to either get rid of said Enemies that can take advantage of Marks or get rid of the Swine Drummer quickly before it can Mark your Heroes.

Overall Threat Level
Medium Low
High if Enemies with Mark Synergy are Present
Swine Wretch
Warrens
Vomit
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Veteran
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Disease Resist Hero
60% Chance to Target Marked Hero
20% Chance to Target Lowest Disease Resist Hero
Champion
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Disease Resist Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
16.5% Chance to Target Lowest Disease Resist Hero
Skill Breakdown
Vomit is a Decently Accurate High Crit Chance Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal HP Damage alongside Stress Damage.
This Attack can inflict a - Dodge Debuff to the Target Hero from Veteran Difficulty onwards and has a hefty 33% Chance to inflict a Disease.
Overall Analysis
The Swine Wretch is a Low HP Backline Enemy with High Speed & Dodge that uses Vomit to inflict Diseases and spread Stress to your Heroes

Although Stress Damage is troublesome, the main threat the Swine Wretch poses is its 33% Chance to Disease the Target Hero.

The fact that Diseases can worsen a Hero by a significant amount alongside the other drawbacks they can cause makes this High Disease Chance very troublesome

Due to these factors, the Swine Wretch should be eliminated quickly before it can cause you any problems.

It is preferrable to have a Hero who can Outspeed the Swine Wretch and Stun them to shut them down for the turn, giving the others Heroes time to finish them off quickly.

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Swine Slasher
Warrens
Hook Where It Hurts
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
1.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Veteran
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Champion
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Hook Where It Hurts is a Decently Accurate Very High Crit Chance Single Target Attack usable from all Positions that deals Decent Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Ranks while Moving the Swine Slasher Back.
This Attack gains a Bleed and Disease Resist Debuff from Veteran Difficulty onwards which synergizes with the many Warrens Enemies that inflict Disease or Bleed.
Overall Analysis
The Swine Slasher is a Low HP Enemy with Decent Speed & Dodge alongside High Prot that threatens to dish out High Damage Crits using Hook Where It Hurts.

This Enemy also gains 2 turns of Stealth at the start of any Combat from Veteran Difficulty onwards, making it harder to get rid of.

The Swine Slasher can prove to be a great threat due to the High Burst Damage potential of Hook Where It Hurts.

It should be noted that the Swine Slasher cannot Target Heroes in the 4th Position.

Although the Swine Slasher is quite dangerous, unless you have a good way to Destealth them, it is usually better to deal with the other threatening Warrens Enemies accompanying the Swine Slasher.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Carrion Eater
Warrens
Courtyard
Munch
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Veteran
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Champion
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Munch is a Decently Accurate High Crit Chance Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals Low Baseline Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Ranks alongside inflicting Blight.
This Attack benefits from a +100% Damage Buff when Targetting Marked Heroes and has a Chance to inflct a Random Disease from Veteran Difficulty onwards (Veteran - 7% // Champion - 9%).
Overall Analysis
The Carrion Eater is a Low HP Enemy with overall High Resistances that can deal Hefty Damage to Marked Targets using Munch.

Although the Carrion Eater by itself is of minor threat, it is usually accompanied by Enemies that can set up Marks for the Carrion Eater.

While the Blight Munch inflicts is relatively weak, it is still a threat due to it being able to finish off a Hero at Death's Door.

If a Hero is getting focused down by Carrion Eater Enemies or is in Danger, remember that Munch cannot Target Heroes in the 4th Rank.

If needed, using a Marked Hero with High Prot or Dodge to Tank or Evade the Attacks of the Carrion Eater is a valid option, although this is a risky tactic in the Warrens alongside the fact that the threat of Disease still persists.

It is in your best interest to eliminate any Enemies accompanying the Carrion Eater that can Mark your Heroes.

In addition, due to the Carrion Eater having Low HP, killing them off before they can do much is a viable option.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Large Carrion Eater
Warrens
Courtyard
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Veteran
Tentacle Devour
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Weaken Prey
1.0 Base Chance to be used unless 2+ Heroes are Marked
6.0 Base Chance to be used Turn 1 unless 2+ Heroes are Marked
Champion
Tentacle Devour
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
5.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
83.5% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Weaken Prey
1.0 Base Chance to be used unless 2+ Heroes are Marked
8.0 Base Chance to be used Turn 1 unless 2+ Heroes are Marked
Skill Breakdown
Tentacle Devour is a Decently Accurate High Crit Chance Attack usable from all Positions that deals Very High Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Ranks.

This Attack benefits from a +100% Damage Buff when Targetting Marked Heroes, which Skyrockets its Damage up, making it easily able to bring a Hero at Full Health down to Death's Door.

Weaken Prey is a Decently Accurate Attack usable from all Positions that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Positions alongside Marking them. This Attack also inflicts a hefty Debuff to the Target Hero's Damage and Accuracy.

The Large Carrion Eater has a High Chance to use Weaken Prey as its first action.
Overall Analysis
The Large Carrion Eater is a Size 2 Enemy with some Prot and overall High Resists that can set up Marks for other Enemies to take advantage of using Weaken Prey, alongside using Tentacle Devour to take advantage of it as well, dealing Massive Damage if the Attack lands.

The Large Carrion Eater can be very threatening, although it should be noted that it greatly appreciates other Enemies supporting it.

With that in mind, it can be a good idea to Stun the Large Carrion Eater to keep it in check while dealing with the Enemies accompanying the Large Carrion Eater.

It should be noted that the Large Carrion Eater cannot Target Heroes in the 4th Position.

If needed, using a Marked Hero with High Prot or Dodge to Tank or Evade the Attacks of the Large Carrion Eater is a valid option, although this is a risky tactic in the Warrens.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Swinetaur
Warrens
All Difficulties
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Pig Spear
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Boar Rush
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Bramded Hero
1.0 Base Chance to Target Highest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
25% Chance to Target Highest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
Trot Retreat
3.0 Base Chance to be used if there is no Ally Swinetaur Present & at least 1 other Monster is Present
Crunching Backhand
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Bramded Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Pig Spear is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals High Damage to all 4 Heroes.

Boar Rush is a Decently Accurate High Crit Chance Single Target Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals Very High Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks.

This Attack has an Extremely High Chance to inflict a Stun to the Target Hero while causing Knockback, potentially Moving them to Position 4.

Trot Retreat is a Skill used by the Swinetaur to Move itself to the Back Ranks so it can use its 2 very dangerous Back Rank Attacks on its next turn.

This Skill has a High Chance to be used unless there are no other Monsters present and is only usable if the Swinetaur is in the Front 3 Positions.

In addition, the Skill will not be used if there is another Swinetaur present, preventing an endless loop of 2 Swinetaurs using Trot Retreat.

Crunching Backhand is an Attack usable from Position 1 that deals Decent Damage to 1 or 2 Heroes in the Front 3 Positions alongside a Weak Stun.
Overall Analysis
The Swinetaur is a Very High HP Size 2 Enemy with High Prot alongside a High Stun and Move Resist Stat.

The Swinetaur relies on being in the Back 2 Ranks in order to use its 2 highly threatening Attacks - Pig Spear and Boar Rush reliably.

The best way to stop the Swinetaur from getting to the Back 2 Positions is to eliminate the Enemies accompanying it.

Considering that the Swinetaur is very difficult to kill quickly and poses very little threat if on its own, it is in your best interest to prioritize getting rid of the Enemies accompanying the Swinetaur

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Swine Skiver
Warrens
Champion
Cooldowns
Spit to Roast - 1 rd Cooldown
Spit to Roast
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
6.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Cripple Them
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Goring Flight
7.0 Base Chance to be used if 3+ Enemy Positions are occupied by Monsters
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Skill Breakdown
Spit to Roast is a Decently Accurate Very High Crit Chance Single Target Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals High Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Positions while Moving the Skiver Forward.

This Attack can inflict a Stun to the Target Hero while inflicting Knockback, potentially Moving them to Position 4.

Goring Flight is a Single Target Repositioning Attack usable in the Front 2 Positions that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions while Moving the Skiver Back.

This Attack has a much Higher Chance to be used if at least 3 Enemy Positions are occupied in order to ensure the Swine Skiver ends up at the Back 2 Ranks after it is used.

If not, Goring Flight is only guarenteed to be used if the Swine Skiver is in Position 1, and Spit to Roast will take priority if the Swine Skiver is in Position 2 unless the Attack is on Cooldown.

Cripple Them is an AoE Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals High HP Damage to all Heroes in the Back 3 Positions alongside a relatively Weak Blight.

This Attack can also inflict a Significant - Speed Debuff alongside a - Dodge Debuff to all Target Heroes.
Overall Analysis
The Swine Skiver is a High HP Backline Enemy with High Speed and Dodge in addition to some Prot that applies a Large amount of offensive pressure to your Heroes using Spit to Roast and Cripple Them.

Due to the Swine Skiver having overall superb Stats and the offensive pressure it applies, it is dreaded by many players and is considered to be the most dangerous Enemy in the game.

Using Skills like Disorienting Blast or Flashbang to Shuffle the Swine Skiver to the Front while Stunned effectively shuts it down for 2 turns.

That being Stuns by themselves are still very useful for keeping the Swine Skiver in check while you try to get rid of it.

Using Mark tactics to focus the Skiver down can also be a good way to eliminate it quickly.

Although the Swine Skiver should be a top priority to get rid of, the other threatening Warrens Enemies accompanying it should not be ignored, for single mindedly focusing on the Swine Skiver will let those Enemies show you what they are made of.

Overall Threat Level: Very High

Pelagic Grouper
Cove
Apprentice
Seaward Slash
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
1.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Spearfishing
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
1.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Veteran
Seaward Slash
2.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
60% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Spearfishing
2.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
60% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Champion
Seaward Slash
3.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
7.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
70% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Spearfishing
3.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
7.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
70% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Seaward Slash is a Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals High HP Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions.

Spearfishing is a Single Target Attack usable from the Back 2 Positions that deals High HP Damage to a Hero in the Back 2 Ranks.

This Attack gains the ability to Pull the Target Hero Forward from Veteran Difficulty onwards.
Overall Analysis
The Pelagic Grouper is an Enemy with Decently High Speed that can dish out High Damage to the Front 2 Ranks using Seaward Slash and deal Decent Damage to the Back 2 Ranks using Spearfishing.

Due to their Abysmal Stun Resist Stat, Stuns are very effective for shutting them down for a turn, limiting their Damage output and giving your Heroes more time to deal with them.

When dealing with the Pelagic Grouper, it is useful to keep in mind that they can only use Seaward Slash if in the Front 2 Positions and Spearfishing if in the Back 2 Ranks.

Overall Threat Level: Borderline High

Pelagic Shaman
Cove
Cooldowns
Apprentice
Sea Breeze - 3 rd Cooldown
Veteran & Champion
Sea Breeze - 2 rd Cooldown
All Difficulties
Call of the Deep - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Stress Wave
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
50% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Call of the Deep
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Sea Breeze
1.0 Base Chance to be used if any Allies have 70% HP
Targetting Desire
5.0 Base Chance Target Ally with Lowest HP %
83.3% Chance to Target Ally with Lowest HP %
Veteran
Stress Wave
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
66% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Call of the Deep
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Sea Breeze
1.0 Base Chance to be used if any Allies have 70% HP
Targetting Desire
5.0 Base Chance Target Ally with Lowest HP %
83.3% Chance to Target Ally with Lowest HP %
Champion
Stress Wave
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
75% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Call of the Deep
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Sea Breeze
1.0 Base Chance to be used if any Allies have 70% HP
Targetting Desire
5.0 Base Chance Target Ally with Lowest HP %
83.3% Chance to Target Ally with Lowest HP %
Skill Breakdown
Stress Wave is a Decently Accurate Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals minimal HP Damage alongside a hefty amount of Stress Damage to 1 or 2 Heroes in any Position whilst Moving the Pelagic Shaman Back.

Ceremonial Cut is a Low Accuracy Single Target Attack used from Position 1 that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks.

Call of the Deep is a Support Skill usable from the Back 3 Positions that the Pelagic Shaman uses to Buff an Ally's Accuracy, Crit Chance, and Damage.

Sea Breeze is a Support Skill usable from the Back 3 Positions that the Pelagic Shaman uses to Heal an Ally.

This Skill has a Very High Chance to be used on the Ally with the Lowest HP %
Overall Analysis
The Pelagic Shaman is a Low HP Backline Enemy with High Speed and Dodge that deals Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside supporting their Allies with Buffs and Healing.

They also gain 2 Turns of Stealth at the start of any Combat from Veteran Difficulty onwards, making them harder to eliminate.

Sea Breeze can cause you trouble especially if the Pelagic Shaman Targets a Drowned Thrall, and Call of the Deep can make Dangerous Monsters such as the Pelagic Grouper more of a threat.

Due to the Pelagic Shaman being quite troublesome due to its Stress Dealing Attacks and Support Skills, it is a good idea to eliminate them early on.

It is preferrable to have a Hero who can outspeed and Stun the Pelagic Shaman, shutting it down for the turn and giving your other Heroes time to get rid of it.

If possible, Moving the Pelagic Shaman to Position 1 can be a good way to neutralize them due to them only being able to use Ceremonial Cut.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Pelagic Guardian
Cove
Cooldowns
Barnacle Barrier - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Octocestus
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to be Target Marked Hero
66% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Barnacle Barrier
2.0 Base Chance if there are no Guarded Monsters
Turn 1: 5.0 Base Chance if there are no Guarded Monsters
Veteran
Octocestus
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to be Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Barnacle Barrier
2.0 Base Chance if there are no Guarded Monsters
Turn 1: 5.0 Base Chance if there are no Guarded Monsters
Champion
Octocestus
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to be Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Barnacle Barrier
2.0 Base Chance if there are no Guarded Monsters
Turn 1: 5.0 Base Chance if there are no Guarded Monsters
Skill Breakdown
Octocestus is a Single Target Attack usable from all Positions that deals Mediocre Damage alongside inflicting Bleed to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions.

Barnacle Barrier is a Support Skill the Pelagic Guardian uses to Guard an Ally while Buffing its own Prot to let it take more hits.

This Skill can only be used if there are no Guarded Monsters Present and has a Very High Chance to be used on its first turn.
Overall Analysis
The Pelagic Guardian is a High HP Frontline Enemy with High Prot that can Guard their Allies with Barnacle Barrier and inflict Bleed using Octocestus.

The Pelagic Guardian by itself lacks any significant Damage output, making it not much of a threat

The Pelagic Guardian instead Guards other more threatening Enemies such as the Pelagic Shaman or the Drowned Thrall.

Stuns are especially effective against the Pelagic Guardian, shutting it down for a turn whilst breaking its Guard

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Sea Maggot
Cove
Brine
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Disease Resist Hero
50% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Disease Resist
Veteran
2.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Disease Resist Hero
66% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Disease Resist
Champion
2.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Disease Resist Hero
66% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Disease Resist
Skill Breakdown
Brine is a Low Accuracy Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Low Damage to the Target Hero in addition to inflicting a hefty - Dodge Debuff and - Speed Debuff.
This Attack also has an 8% Chance to inflict a Random Disease, which can prove to be troublsome
Overall Analysis
The Sea Maggot is a Very Low HP Enemy with very High Prot, High Stun Resist, and Very Low Speed that can Debuff your Heroes using Brine, its only Attack.

Since the Sea Maggot has Very High Prot but Very Low HP, DoTs and Armor Piercing Attacks are best for dealing with it.

Due to Diseases potentially being very disruptive and hindering, it is a good idea to get rid of the Sea Maggot early on in the Battle.

Overall Threat Level: Low

Deep Stinger
Cove
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Shocker
Requires there to be at least 2 Non Stunned Heroes to be used
1.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
66% Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
Salty Gouge
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
50% Chance to Target Hero with the Lowest Bleed Resist
Veteran
Shocker
1.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
+ 5.0 Base Chance to be used if Uca Crusher is Present
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
75% Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
Salty Gouge
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
66% Chance to Target Hero with the Lowest Bleed Resist
Champion
Shocker
1.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
+5.0 Base Chance to be used if Uca Crusher is Present
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
80% Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
Salty Gouge
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
75% Chance to Target Hero with the Lowest Bleed Resist
Skill Breakdown
Shocker is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal HP Damage to the Target Hero alongside potentially Stunning them.

The Bleed Resist Debuff the Attack can inflict can be troublesome as well, making the Hero more susceptible to Bleeds from Enemies such as the Deep Stinger itself and the Uca Crusher.

Salty Gouge is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Low Damage alongside inflicting Bleed in addition to a - Dodge Debuff to the Target Hero.

Both Attacks have a 6% Chance to inflict a Random Disease to the Target Hero, which can prove to be troublesome
Overall Analysis
The Deep Stinger is a Low HP Enemy with High Speed and Dodge alongside a Decently High Stun Resist Stat that can use its High Accuracy Attacks to Stun, Bleed and Disease your Heroes.

Shocker is used to Stun a Hero while Debuffing their Bleed Resist for itself and other Bleed causing Enemies, and has a Very High Chance to be used on its first turn.

Although the Deep Stinger doesn't deal much Damage, its ability to disrupt your Heroes with Stuns and aid its Allies through the - Bleed Resist Debuff it can inflict can prove to be troublesome.

Considering both Attacks of the Deep Stinger have a chance to inflict a Disease, it is a good idea to consider eliminating them early on since they aren't too difficult to kill.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Drowned Thrall
Cove
All Difficulties
Gargling Grab
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
The Revenge
100000.0 Base Chance to be used as Second Action
Skill Breakdown
Gargling Grab is a Low Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals High HP Damage and some Stress Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions.

The Revenge is an AoE Attack usable from any Position that deals Extremely High HP Damage and Decently High Stress Damage to all of your Heroes.

This Attack is used if the Drowned Thrall Enemy is allowed to take its second action, upon which it kills itself to use The Revenge.
Overall Analysis
The Drowned Thrall is a Slow Enemy with a Middling HP Pool that relies on surviving until it can take its second action so it can use The Revenge, a Highly threatening Attack.

Although the Drowned Thrall by itself is quite easy to kill, the fact that other Enemies may support it can be troublesome.

For Example, the Pelagic Guardian may Guard the Drowned Thrall, the Pelagic Shaman may Heal it using Sea Breeze,and the Deep Stinger could Stun your Heroes.

Notably, the Drowned Thrall cannot take actions whilst Stunned, making Stuns a viable way to give yourself more time to eliminate it.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low
Kill Before 2nd Action

Uca Crusher
Cove
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Veteran
Arterial Pinch
2.0 Base Chance to be used
5.0 Base Chance to be used if Deep Stinger is Present
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
75% Chance to Target Hero with the Lowest Bleed Resist
Tidal Slam
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
Arterial Pinch
2.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used if Deep Stinger is Present
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
80% Chance to Target Hero with the Lowest Bleed Resist
Tidal Slam
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Arterial Pinch is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals Minimal HP Damage alongside a Staggering amount of Bleed with a nasty - Healing Received Debuff to a Target Hero in the Front 3 Positions.

It should be noted that this Attack has a Very High Chance to Target the Hero with the Lowest Bleed Resist Stat.

Tidal Slam is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Decent Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions.

This Attack can Stun a Frontline Hero alongside possibly sending them to the Back Ranks, which can end up greatly hindering the Hero.
Overall Analysis
The Uca Crusher is a High HP Size 2 Enemy with High Prot that can dish out huge amounts of Bleed using Arterial Pinch or disrupt your Frontline Heroes using Tidal Slam.

Similarly to the - Healing Received Debuff that Butcher Cut inflicts, this Debuff can prove to be troublesome by making it so the Hero cannot recover from big hits easily.

Although the Bleeds it can inflict alongside the - Healing Received Debuff can be a threat if left unchecked, the Uca Crusher doesn't deal much Direct Damage, leading it to being completely countered if you have a way to reliably cure its Bleeds or Resist them.

If no Plague Doctor is avaliable to simply cure the Bleeds, using Heroes with High Dodge to Dodge Arterial Pinch can be a Decent Solution.

Stuns can come in handy by being able to limit the amount of Bleed the Uca Crusher can inflict to your Heroes.

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Squiffy Ghast
Cove
Cooldowns
Offkilter Jig - 1 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Champion
Maddening Shanty
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
10000.0 Base Chance to Target Jester if Present
Offkilter Jig
1000000000.0 Base Chance to be used if 3+ Ranks are
occupied by Monsters
Skill Breakdown
Maddening Shanty is a relatively Low Accuracy Single Target Attack without Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal HP Damage and some Stress Damage while Moving the Squiffy Ghast to Position 1

This Attack always Targets a Jester if one is Present, and has a Low Chance to apply a +10% Stress Debuff to the Target Hero which lasts until the next time the Party Camps

Offkilter Jig is a relatively Low Accuracy AoE Attack that deals some Stress Damage in addition to inflicting Horror to all 4 of your Heroes while Moving the Squiffy Ghast to the Back Ranks.

This Attack can only be used if the Squiffy Ghast is in the Front 2 Ranks alongside at least 2 other Enemy Positions being Filled (Corpses do not count).
Overall Analysis
The Squiffy Ghast is a High HP Enemy with High, Speed, and Dodge on top of a High Stun and Bleed Resist Stat that can potentially deal Massive Stress Damage with Offkilter Jig

It should be noted that the Attacks of the Squiffy Ghast have relatively Low Accuracy, making them not too hard to Dodge.

One way to deal with the Squiffy Ghast is the direct approach of taking advantage of its Low Move Resist by using Skills that cause Knockback to send the Squiffy Ghast to the Back Ranks, where it cannot use Offkilter Jig.

Another way to trivialize the Squiffy Ghast is to eliminate the Enemies accompanying it until there are less than 3 total Enemy Positions filled, in which case the Squiffy Ghast cannot use Offkilter Jig

The Squiffy Ghast has many parallels to the Jester with Maddening Shanty and Offkilter Jig being similar to the Jester's Solo and Finale Skills in that the User uses a Skill to Move to the Front Ranks to use their High Impact Attack.

There being an Achievement to Kill the Squiffy Ghast with Finale and the fact that Maddening Shanty always Targets the Jester if one is present futher confirms their rivalry.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Brigand Cutthroat
Ruins, Weald
Cove, Warrens
Hamlet
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Slice And Dice
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Uppercut Slice
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Shank
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
25% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Bleed Resist
Harmless Poke
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Slice And Dice
2.0 Base Chance to be used
7.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Uppercut Slice
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Shank
2.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used as Second Action
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
60% Chance to Target Marked Hero
20% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Bleed Resist
Harmless Poke
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
Slice And Dice
2.0 Base Chance to be used
7.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Uppercut Slice
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Shank
2.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used as Second Action
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
16.65% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Bleed Resist
Harmless Poke
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Slice And Dice is a High Crit Chance AoE Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Decent Damage alongside inflicting a - Bleed Resist Debuff to both Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks.

Uppercut Slice is a Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Low Damage alongside causing Knockback to a Target Hero in the Front 3 Ranks.

Shank is a Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Decently High Damage alongside a Bleed to a Hero in any Rank.

Harmless Poke is a Very Low Accuracy Single Target Repositioning Attack that deals Low Damage while Moving the Brigand Cutthroat Forward.

This Attack is only used if the Brigand Cutthroat is at Position 4 and can Target Heroes in any Rank and applies a Speed Buff to the Brigand Cutthroat if it hits the Target Hero.
Overall Analysis
The Brigand Cutthroat is a relatively Low HP Enemy with some Prot that can dish out a surprising amount of Damage with Slice And Dice alongside Shank.

The Brigand Cutthroat can apply a large amount of offensive pressure to your Heroes with Slice And Dice & Shank, both of which deal good Damage and have a Higher Chance to be used.

The fact that the Brigand Cutthroat can pose such a threat on top of having a somewhat Small HP Pool makes them a High Priority to be eliminated quickly.

Stuns can be useful for shutting down the Brigand Cutthroat for a turn, giving your Heroes more time to get rid of the Brigand Cutthroat and other threats

You can also try to Move them to Position 4, where they can only use Harmless Poke, a Weak Repositioning Attack

Overall Threat Level: Borderline High

Brigand Fusilier
Ruins, Weald
Cove, Warrens
Hamlet
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Blanket Fire
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Rushed Shot
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Veteran
Blanket Fire
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Rushed Shot
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Champion
Blanket Fire
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Rushed Shot
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Blanket Fire is an AoE Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals Low Damage alongside inflicting a Minor - Dodge Debuff to all 4 Heroes.

Rushed Shot is a Low Accuracy Single Target Repositioning Attack that deals Low Damage while Moving the Brigand Fusilier Back.

This Attack is only used if the Brigand Fusilier is at Position 1 and can Target a Hero in the Front 3 Positions.
Overall Analysis
The Brigand Fusilier is a Relatively Low HP Backline Enemy with Decent Speed that uses Blanket Fire to chip down your Heroes alongside Debuffing their Dodge.

They also gain 2 Turns of Stealth at the start of any Combat from Veteran Difficulty onwards, making them harder to eliminate.

The Brigand Fusilier poses barely any threat, with Blanket Fire dealing too Low Damage to be of any real concern.

Due to the Brigand Fusilier usually being accompanied by the much more threatening Brigand Cutthroat and/or Brigand Bloodletter Enemies, it is better to focus on the more threatening Brigands first.

This is especially true from Veteran Difficulty onward, where the Brigand Fusilier starts with 2 turns of Stealth, making them harder to eliminate.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Brigand Bloodletter
Ruins, Weald
Cove, Warrens
Hamlet
Cooldowns
Apprentice
Point Blank Shot - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
Apprentice
Punishment
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
25% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Bleed Resist
Rain of Whips
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Point Blank Shot
1.0 Base Chance to be used
4.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Veteran
Punishment
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
25% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Bleed Resist
Rain of Whips
1.0 Base Chance to be used
4.0 Base Chance to be used if Brigand Cutthroat Present
Point Blank Shot
1.0 Base Chance to be used
4.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Champion
Punishment
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
25% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Bleed Resist
Rain of Whips
2.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used if Brigand Cutthroat Present
Point Blank Shot
1.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Skill Breakdown
Rain of Whips is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable in the Front 3 Positions that deals Minimal HP Damage and some Minor Stress Damage alongside inflicting Bleed to all 4 Heroes.

From Veteran Difficulty onwards, this Attack has a Higher Chance to be used if a Brigand Cutthroat is Present.

Punishment is a Decently Accurate High Crit Chance Single Target Attack without Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Low HP and Stress Damage alongside a Bleed to the Target Hero.

Point Blank Shot is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with a Very High Crit Chance that is usable from Position 1 and Targets the Hero in Position 1, potentially dealing Very High Damage.

This Attack is very likely to be used as the First Action of the Brigand Bloodletter and Knocks the Target Hero Back.

The Brigand Bloodletter also suffers a - Speed Debuff upon using this Attack.

It should be noted Apprentice Level Brigand Bloodletter Enemies have a 2 round Cooldown on Point Blank Shot, whereas the Attack has no Cooldown from Veteran Difficulty onward.
Overall Analysis
The Brigand Bloodletter is a Size 2 Enemy that can inflict Stress Damage and Bleeds to your Party using Punishment or Rain of Whips and deal Very High Damage to the Position 1 Hero using Point Blank Shot.

The main threat the Brigand Bloodletter poses is Point Blank Shot, which has a Very High Chance to be used as the Brigand Bloodletter's First Action.

You can use the fact that Point Blank Shot can only Target Heroes in Position 1 by having Heroes High Prot or Dodge to tank the hits.

In addition, you can take advantage of the fact that the Brigand Bloodletter must be at Position 1 to use Point Blank Shot, so Moving them to Position 2 or 3 will make the Brigand Bloodletter unable to use Point Blank Shot

Since the Brigand Bloodletter isn't as much of a threat if alone, it may be a good call to use Stuns to keep them in check while getting rid of the Enemies accompanying the Brigand Bloodletter.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Cultist Brawler
Ruins
Weald
Cove
Warrens
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Rend for the Old Gods
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Stumbling Scratch
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Rend for the Old Gods
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Stumbling Scratch
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
Rend for the Old Gods
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Stumbling Scratch
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Rend for the Old Gods is a High Crit Chance Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Low HP Damage alongside inflicting Bleed to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks while Moving the Cultist Brawler Forward.

This Attack benefits from a +50% Damage Buff when Targetting Marked Heroes and can apply a + Stress Debuff to your Heroes, which synergizes with the Attack's High Crit Chance and the Stress inflicting Enemies that will likely be accompanying them.

Stumbling Scratch is a Low Accuracy Single Target Repositioning Attack usable from the Back 2 Positions that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions while Moving the Cultist Brawler Forward.
Overall Analysis
The Cultist Brawler is a Frontline Enemy with Decent Speed that can inflict Bleed and help other Enemies deal more Stress Damage to your Heroes.

The Cultist Brawler doesn't pose much of a threat due to their main Attack Rend for the Old Gods dealing Decent at best Damage even to Marked Targets.

Both of its Attacks can only Target the Front 2 Positions, making the Cultist Brawler very predictable and easy to deal with.

You can easily Stun the Cultist Brawler or Move it to the Back 2 Positions to render them helpless

Due to these factors, it is usually better to take out the bigger threats that accompanying the Cultist Brawler.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Cultist Acolyte
Ruins
Weald
Cove
Warrens
Cooldowns
Veteran & Champion
Eldritch Push - 2 rd Cooldown
Eldritch Pull - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Stressful Incantation
2.0 Base Chance to be used
7.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
50% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Eldritch Push
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Eldritch Pull
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Stressful Incantation
Unless All 4 Heroes are Virtued or 3+ Marked Heroes are Present
2.0 Base Chance to be used
7.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Eldritch Push
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Eldritch Pull
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
Stressful Incantation
Unless All 4 Heroes are Virtued or 3+ Marked Heroes are Present
2.0 Base Chance to be used
7.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
75% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Eldritch Push
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Eldritch Pull
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Stressful Incantation is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals minimal HP Damage and a hefty amount of Stress Damage to the Target Hero alongside Lowering the Light Level.

This Attack gains the ability to Mark Heroes from Veteran Difficulty onward, helping the many Enemies who have a bias towards Targetting Marked Heroes or have a Bonus vs Marked Targets focus down the Marked Hero.

Eldritch Pull is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals Minimal HP Damage while Pulling a Hero in the Back 2 Ranks Forward.

This Attack deals Minor Stress Damage from Veteran Difficulty onward alongside a 2 round Cooldown.

Eldritch Push is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from all positions that deals Minimal HP Damage while Pushing a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks to the Back Ranks.

This Attack deals Minor Stress Damage from Veteran Difficulty onward alongside a 2 round Cooldown.
Overall Analysis
The Cultist Acolyte is a Backline Enemy with High Speed and Dodge that dishes out Stress Damage (And can Mark Heroes from Veteran Difficulty Onwards) with Stressful Incantation and disrupts your Heroes using Eldritch Pull and Eldritch Push.

Due to the Cultist Acolyte being able to deal hefty Stress Damage to your Heroes and the disruption they can cause, it is in your best interest to eliminate it quickly.

It is preferrable to have a Hero who can Outspeed the Cultist Acolyte and Stun them to shut them down for the turn, giving your other Heroes time to finish them off quickly.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Madman
Ruins, Weald
Cove, Warrens
Hamlet
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Accusation
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
50% Chance to Target Hero Most Stress
Doomsay
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Accusation
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
66.7% Chance to Target Hero Most Stress
Doomsay
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
Accusation
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
75% Chance to Target Hero Most Stress
Doomsay
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Doomsay is a Very Accurate AoE Attack usable from any Position that deals no Damage but inflicts Stress Damage to all 4 of your Heroes.

Accusation is a Very Accurate Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal HP Damage and inflicts Horror to the Target Hero.

This Attack also has a Chance to inflict a + Stress Debuff to the Target Hero which lasts until the Party Camps.
Overall Analysis
The Madman is a Backline Enemy with Very High Speed and Dodge that can Spread a hefty amount of Stress using its 2 Attacks.

It is preferrable to have a Hero who can Outspeed the Madman and Stun them to shut them down for the turn and have the other Heroes finish them off quickly.

The Madman has a roughly 4% Chance to drop one of the Music Box Trinkets as Loot, which could come in handy.

Overall Threat Level: High

Webber
Ruins
Weald
Warrens
Courtyard
All Difficulties
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
10.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
91.4% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Bite
10.0 Base Chance to be used if Marked Hero Present
Web
3.0 Base Chance to be used unless 3+ Heroes are Marked
Skill Breakdown
Web is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal Damage alongside a Marking the Target Hero.

This Attack can also Stun your Heroes in addition to inflicting a - Blight Resist Debuff.

Bite is a Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Very Low Damage and inflicts Blight to the Target Hero.

Even though this Attack benefits from a +100% Damage Buff when Targetting a Marked Hero, it is not much of a threat due to its Very Low Baseline Damage.
Overall Analysis
The Webber is a very Low HP Enemy with Decent Speed and High Dodge that uses Web to disrupt your Heroes and set of Marks for Spitters.

When dealing with Spiders, you want to be taking out the Webbers First due to them having Higher Speed and the fact that Spitters pose no threat without Webbers setting up Marks for them.

Spit cannot be used at the Front 2 Positions, meaning if both Webbers are dead, the remaining Spitters are forced to use Bite, a much less threatening Attack.

Stuns can also be used to stop some of the Spiders from acting, although due to their Low HP Pool, just killing them is preferred and safer

Overall Threat Level: Prioritize over Spitters if possible

Spitter
Ruins
Weald
Warrens
Courtyard
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
100.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Spit is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from the Back 2 Positions that deals Mediocre Baseline Damage and inflicts Blight to a Hero in any Position.

This Attack can also inflict a - Accuracy Debuff to your Heroes, making it harder for them to land their Attacks.

More importantly, This Attack benefits from a +100% Damage Buff when Targetting Marked Heroes, letting the Attack deal a High Amount of Damage.

Bite is a Single Target Attack usable in the Front 2 Positions that deals Very Low Damage and Blight to a Hero in any Position.

Even though this Attack benefits from a +100% Damage Buff when Targetting a Marked Hero, it is not much of a threat due to its Very Low Baseline Damage.
Overall Analysis
The Spitter is a very Low HP Enemy with High Dodge that uses Spit to deal very High Damage to Marked Heroes.

When dealing with Spiders, you want to be taking out the Webbers First due to them having Higher Speed and the fact that Spitters pose no threat without Webbers setting up Marks for them.

Spit cannot be used at the Front 2 Positions, meaning if both Webbers are dead, the remaining Spitters are forced to use Bite, a much less threatening Attack.

Stuns can also be used to stop some of the Spiders from acting, although due to their Low HP Pool, simply killing them is preferred and safer

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Maggot
Ruins
Weald
Warrens
Courtyard
Grave Nibble
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
3.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Stun Resist
75% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Stun Resist
Skill Breakdown
Grave Nibble is a Low Accuracy High Crit Chance Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Low HP Damage and Minor Stress Damage alongside a relatively Low Chance to Stun the Target Hero.
The real threat this Attack poses comes in the form of its hefty 15% Chance to inflict a Random Disease, which can prove to be troublesome.
Overall Analysis
The Maggot is a Very Low HP Enemy with a High Stun Resist Stat that can inflict Stress, Stuns, and Disease to your Heroes using Grave Nibble.

Due to its Small HP Pool. the Maggot can be easily eliminated, which should be done quickly before any Disease can be spread.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Bump in the Night is a Low Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Ranks that deals Low Damage to Heroes in the Front 2 Positions.
Tic-Toc is a Very Inaccurate Single Target Repositioning Attack used from Position 4 that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks while Moving the Bone Rabble Forward.
Overall Analysis
The Bone Rabble has overall Low Stats alongside Weak Attacks with Low Damage and Accuracy.

Due to the Bone Rabble being a non threat, it should be the last thing you deal with.

Overall Threat Level: Very Low

Gargoyle
Ruins
Weald
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Veteran
Flurry of Claws
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Lash of the Tail
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Champion
Flurry of Claws
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Lash of the Tail
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
33.3% Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Flurry of Claws is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Very Low Damage to both Front Rank Heroes and has a Very Low Chance to Shuffle them.

Lash of the Tail is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal Damage to the Target Hero.

This Attack can Stun the Target Hero and has a Low Chance to cause Knockback as well.
Overall Analysis
The Gargoyle is a Low HP Enemy with High Speed, Decent Dodge, and High Bleed Resist that attempts to disrupt your Heroes using its Attacks, both of which have a Chance to displace the Target Hero.

That being said although the Stun Chance on Lash of the Tail is standard, the Knockback and Shuffle Chances of the 2 Attacks are too Low to actually do anything.

The Gargoyle is more of an annoyance more than anything and can be largely ignored while you prioritize getting rid of more threatening Enemies.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Ghoul
Ruins, Weald
Warrens, Cove
Courtyard

Rend

2.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress
50% Chance to Target Marked Hero
33.3% Chance to Target Non Stunned Hero with Most Stress
Howl
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion
Rend
1.0 Base Chance to be used

80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skull Toss
2.0 Base Chance to be used

4.0 Base Chance to Target Hero with Most Stress

44.4% Chance to Target Non Stunned Hero with Most Stress
Howl

Skill Breakdown
Rend is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Decently High Damage alongside a High Crit Chance to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks.

This Attack can inflict a + Stress Debuff to the Target Hero and has a High Chance to be used on its first turn

Skull Toss is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals Decently High HP Damage and a hefty amount of Stress Damage alongside having a Chance to Stun a Hero in the Back 2 Positions.

Howl is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from any Position that can inflict Horror to all 4 Heroes while also Lowering the Light Level

This Attack also has a 5% Chance to give the Worries Disease to each Target Hero.
Overall Analysis
The Ghoul is a relatively Low HP Size 2 Enemy with High Speed and Prot that can inflict Stress, Bleed, and Stuns to your Heroes.

The Ghoul is a troublesome Enemy, with all 3 of its Attacks contributing to your Heroes taking more Stress Damage, which is further enabled by its High Speed.

As is the case with many Size 2 Enemies, Stuns are handy for keeping the Ghoul in check while you either focus on getting rid of the Ghoul or get rid of the threats accompanying it

Overall Threat Level: High

Brigand Raider
Ruins, Weald
Cove, Warrens
Hamlet
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Slice And Dice
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Uppercut Slice
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Shank
Not used if 2+ Heroes are Marked
2.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Hero with Lowest Bleed Resist
Harmless Poke
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Slice And Dice is a High Crit Chance AoE Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Decent Damage alongside inflicting a Bleed Resist Debuff to both Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks.

Uppercut Slice is a Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that deals Low Damage alongside inflicting Knockback to a Target Hero in the Front 3 Ranks.

Shank is a Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Decently High Damage alongside a Bleed to a Hero in any Rank.

The Brigand Raider also Marks the Target Hero with this Attack, helping the many Enemies who have a Higher Chance to Target Marked Heroes focus down the Marked Hero with their Attacks.

Harmless Poke is a Very Low Accuracy Single Target Repositioning Attack usable from Position 4 that deals Low Damage to a Hero in any Position while Moving the Brigand Raider Forward.

The Brigand Raider gains a + Speed Buff if the Attack hits.
Overall Analysis
The Brigand Raider Enemy is the Darkest Level version of the Brigand Cutthroat with Slightly Better Stats and Skills overall. It can be encountered during the Brigand Incursion and within Champion Level Dungeons.

The Brigand Raider gains the ability to Mark Heroes with Shank, helping many Enemies who have a Higher Chance to Target Marked Heroes focus down the Marked Hero with their Attacks.

The fact that they can pose a threat with their High Offensive Pressure on top of having a somewhat Small HP Pool makes them a High Priority to be eliminated.

Stuns can be useful for shutting down the Brigand Raider for a turn, giving your Heroes more time to take care of the Brigand Raider and other threats.

You can also try to Move them to Position 4, where they can only use Harmless Poke, a Weak Repositioning Attack

Overall Threat Level: Borderline High

Brigand Hunter
Ruins, Weald
Cove, Warrens
Hamlet
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Blanket Fire
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Rushed Shot
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Blanket Fire is an AoE Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals Low Damage alongside inflicting a Minor Dodge Debuff to all 4 Heroes.

The Brigand Hunter deals minor Stress Damage with Blanket Fire, making the Attack more of a concern.

Rushed Shot is a Low Accuracy Single Target Repositioning Attack usable from Position 1 that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Positions while Moving the Brigand Hunter Back.
Overall Analysis
The Brigand Hunter is the Darkest Level version of the Brigand Fusilier, with Slightly Better Stats and Skills overall. It can be encountered during the Brigand Incursion and within Champion Level Dungeons.

It also starts every Combat with 2 Turns of Stealth, making it harder to deal with.

The Brigand Hunter while being more of a threat than the Brigand Fusilier still proves to be not much of a threat in the Damage department, although the Stress Damage Blanket Fire can inflict can stack up, especially in the case of a Critial Hit.

Although it would be preferrable to take them out early, unless you have the means necessary to get rid of it quickly, it is usually better to focus on dealing with the Brigand Cutthroat and Brigand Raider Enemies accompanying it.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Rattler
Shieldbreaker DLC
Ruins, Weald
Cove, Warrens
Farmstead X
All Difficulties
All Skills
2.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Warning Rattle
5.0 Base Chance to be used unless Self Guarding / Guarded or
less than 2 Monsters aren't Guarded
Targetting Desire
10.0 Base Chance to Target Non Guarding / Guarded Monster
83.3% Chance to Target Non Guarding / Guarded Monster
Snakebite
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
3.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
44.4% Chance to Target Marked Hero
33.3% Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
Slther Forwards
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Warning Rattle is a Support Skill the Rattler uses to Guard its Allies alongside activating its Riposte and Buffing its Prot.

Snakebite is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Decent Damage alongside inflicting Bleed to a Hero in the Front 3 Positions.

Slither Forward is a Single Target Repositioning Attack used from Position 4 that deals Very Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks while Moving the Rattler Forward.
Overall Analysis
The Rattler is one of the Enemies introduced with the Shieldbreaker DLC alongside the Pilskin and Adder.

It is a High HP Enemy with Decent Prot and Dodge alongside High Speed that uses Warning Rattle to Guard an Ally and Snakebite to deal Decent Damage in addition to inflicting Bleed.

The Rattler isn't too much of a threat, although alongside the Bleed or Blight the Serpent Enemies accompanying it will be inflicting, the Damage can stack up.

Due to the Rattler being quite durable, it may be a better idea to take care of the Pilskin Enemy first if you have the tools to Destealth and kill it.

Stuns are very useful for dealing with the Rattler thanks to Stuns letting you shut down the Rattler for a turn while also breaking its Guard.

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Pilskin
Shieldbreaker DLC
Ruins, Weald
Cove , Warrens
Farmstead X
All Difficulties
All Skills
2.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
3.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Blight Resist Hero
44.4% Chance to Target Marked Hero
33.3% Chance to Target Lowest Blight Resist Hero
Infuse
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Venomous Gleek
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Venomous Gleek is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from the Back 2 Positions that deals Minimal Damage and inflicts Blight to a Hero in any Position

Infuse is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack that deals Decent Damage alongside inflicting Blight to the Target Hero.

This Attack can be used if the Pilskin is in the Front 2 Ranks, and can only Target Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks

While the Crit Chance of both Attacks is unremarkable, the +12% Crit Chance Buff the Pilskin benefits from while Stealthed gives it a Very High Chance to Crit if it is allowed to remain Stealthed
Overall Analysis
The Pilskin is one of the Enemies introduced with the Shieldbreaker DLC alongside the Rattler and Adder.

The Pilskin is a Low HP Enemy with Minor Prot, High Dodge and High Speed that deals Blight with its Attacks. They also gain 2 Turns of Stealth at the start of any Combat from making them harder to eliminate, alongside benefitting from a +12 CRIT Buff if they are Stealthed.

The Pilskin isn't too much of a threat, although alongside the High Crit Chance when Stealthed and the Bleed or Blight the Serpent Enemies accompanying it will be inflicting, the Damage can stack up.

When facing a Pilskin, it is advised to Destealth them to deprive them of their + Crit Chance Buff and eliminate them quickly since they have Low HP, making them quite easy to kill once they are Destealthed

It may also be useful to note that they cannot use Infuse from the Back 2 Positions, instead using Venomous Gleek which has Very Low Damage and can only Target the Front 2 Ranks.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Adder
Shieldbreaker DLC
Ruins, Weald
Cove, Warrens
Farmstead X
All Difficulties
All Skills
2.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Molt
1.0 Base Chance to be used if own HP 90%
6.0 Base Chance to be used if own HP 50%
11.0 Base Chance to be used if own HP 20%
+ 3.0 Base Chance to be used if Self has DoTs
(Blight / Bleed)
Adder's Fang
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
3.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Blight Resist Hero
44.4% Chance to Target Marked Hero
33.3% Chance to Target Lowest Blight Resist Hero
Paralyzing Quills
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
3.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
44.4% Chance to Target Marked Hero
33.3% Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
Skill Breakdown
Adder's Fang is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Low Damage and inflicts Blight to a Hero in any Position

Paralyzing Quills is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from all Positions that deals High Damage alongside inflicting a very potent Stun to a Hero in the Front 3 Ranks.

Molt is a Self Healing Skill which Heals the Adder, curing all Bleed, Blight, and Debuffs alongside Buffing its Blight Skill Chance and Damage.

This Skill has a Higher Chance to be used the Less HP the Adder has or if the Adder is suffering from any Bleed or Blight.
Overall Analysis
The Adder is one of the Enemies introduced with the Shieldbreaker DLC alongside the Rattler and Pilskin.

It is a High HP Size 2 Enemy with some Prot that can use its High Accuracy Attacks to Stun or Blight your Heroes alongside being able to cure any Bleed, Blight, or Debuffs inflicted on itself using Molt.

The Adder is only really a threat if other Enemies are present due to it not dealing enough Damage to be of much threat alone.

Due to the Adder not posing much of a threat alone, it is advised to eliminate any Monsters accompanying the Adder while using Stuns to keep it in check.

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Supplicant
Ruins Weald
Cove Warrens
Courtyard
Farmstead X
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
All Skills
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Gather the Blood
4.0 Base Chance to be used
Predigestion
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran & Champion
All Skills
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Gather the Blood
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Predigestion
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Gather the Blood is a Low Damage Single Target Attack usable from the Front 2 Positions that has a 31% Chance to inflict the Crimson Curse to a Hero in any Position while Moving the Supplicant Forward.

Predigestion is a Single Target Attack without Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Low Damage alongside inflicting Blight while Moving the Supplicant Forward.

This Attack can also inflict a - Bleed Resist Debuff that synergizes with the Bleed Heavy Crimson Court Enemies that will be accompanying the Supplicant.
Overall Analysis
The Supplicant is a relatively Low HP Enemy with some Prot and a Sky High Stun Resist Stat that can spread the Crimson Curse using Gather the Blood and inflict Blight using Predigestion.

Due to the Supplicant not dealing much Damage, it doesn't pose much of a threat, and you should be prioritizing the more threatening Crimson Court Enemies accompanying it.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Gatekeeper
Ruins Weald
Cove Warrens
Farmstead X
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Enraging Slight
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
10.0 Base Chance to Target Rank 3 or 4
3.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
71.4% Base Chance to Target Rank 3 or 4
21.4% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Elusive Exit
3.0 Base Chance to be used as Second Action
1003.0 Base Chance to be used as Third Action
Veteran & Champion
Enraging Slight
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
10.0 Base Chance to Target Rank 3 or 4
4.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
66.7% Base Chance to Target Rank 3 or 4
26.7% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Elusive Exit
3.0 Base Chance to be used as Second Action
1003.0 Base Chance to be used as Third Action
Skill Breakdown
Enraging Slight is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals minimal HP Damage alongside Decent Stress Damage.

This Attack also Marks the Target Hero while possibly Pulling them to the Front Ranks, where the Hero will be in more danger of being Focused Down by the many Crimson Court Monsters that have a Higher Chance to Target Marked Heroes.

It should be noted that this Attack has a much Higher Chance to target your (probably) more vulnerable Backline Heroes.

Elusive Exit is a Very Accurate AoE Attack usable from any Position that deals minimal HP Damage and inflicts Horror to all 4 Heroes while the Gatekeeper Escapes from the battle.

After escaping, the Gatekeeper also removes all Enemy Corpses alongside Summoning Sycophant Enemies in all Empty Positions.

This Attack is only usable if the Gatekeeper is taking its Second Action, with a High Chance to be used as its Second Action (66.7% on Apprentice // 75% on Veteran & Champion) and is essentially guarenteed to be used as its Third Action.
Overall Analysis
The Gatekeeper is a Low HP Enemy with High Speed and Very High Dodge that you can encounter when the Infestation Level of the Hamlet is High.

It can use Enraging Slight to deal Stress to your Heroes alongside Marking and Pulling them, and if they are left alive for too long, they will flee the Battle using Elusive Exit, removing any Enemy Corpses and Summoning Sycophant Enemies in empty spaces.

The Gatekeeper always drops an Invitation to the currently active Courtyard Epic Quest alongside being guarenteed to spawn if you interact with a Throbbing Coccoon Curio outside the Courtyard.

Due to Elusive Exit being a highly troublesome Attack, it is in your best interest to eliminate the Gatekeeper quickly.

Thanks to turns while being Stunned not counting as taking an Action, Stunning the Gatekeeper is a good way to delay it from being able to use Elusive Exit.

Overall Threat Level: Very High

Chevalier
Ruins Weald
Cove Warrens
Courtyard
Farmstead X
Cooldowns
Buried Blast - 3 rd Cooldown
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to use Random Skill
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Buried Blast
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Subterranean Skewer
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Subterranean Skewer is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals High Damage alongside inflicting Bleed while Moving the Chevalier Back.

This Attack also inflicts a - Bleed Resist Debuff that synergizes with the Bleed Heavy Crimson Court Enemies accompanying the Chevalier.

Buried Blast is a Decently Accurate Attack which Targets 2 Heroes at once and is usable from the Back 3 Positions alongside being able to Target Heroes in any Position.

Although this Attack cannot Crit, it still deals Decent Damage alongside potentially Stunning your Heroes and more importantly inflicting a Hefty Debuff that Nukes a Hero's Dodge
(-40 on Veteran // -50 on Champion)
Overall Analysis
The Chevalier is a Sturdy Enemy with a Decent Amount of Prot alongside Sky High Move Resist and a Very Low Stun, Bleed, and Debuff Resist Stat.

They can use Subterranean Skewer to dish out High Damage with a Bleed or use Buried Blast to Cripple the Dodge of your Heroes while Stunning them.

The Chevalier can be difficult to deal with due to it being quite Sturdy and its Sky High Move Resist letting it stay in the Back Ranks.

Even though the Chevalier is a big threat, it being so tanky means you may want to deal with the other Enemies that can pose a threat and can be more easily dispatched first.

On top of that, due to the Chevalier having a Very Low Stun Resist Stat, Stuns are very useful for keeping it in check, letting you focus on the other threats first.

That being said if the Chevalier is posing an immediate threat to your and/or you can dispatch it decently easily, it can be beneficial to take it out earlier on in the battle.

Overall Threat Level: High

Manservant
Ruins Weald
Cove Warrens
Courtyard
Farmstead X
The AI Behavior and Skills of the Manservant in its Bloodlust Form are covered in a separate Section.
Cooldowns
Enraging Slight - 1 rd Cooldown
Infallible Servitude - 1 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Enraging Slight
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
75% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Infallible Servitude
2.0 Base Chance to be used unless 2+ Monsters are Guarded
The Thirst
3.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 33%
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Veteran & Champion
Enraging Slight
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
75% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Infallible Servitude
2.0 Base Chance to be used unless 2+ Monsters are Guarded
The Thirst
5.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 55%
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Enraging Slight is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals minimal HP Damage alongside some Stress Damage.

This Attack also Marks the Target Hero while possibly Pulling them to the Front Ranks, where the Hero will be in more danger of being Focused Down by the many Crimson Court Monsters that have a Higher Chance to Target Marked Heroes.

Infallible Servitude is a Support Skill used by the Manservant to Guard one of their Allies while Buffing its own Prot to make itself more durable.

The Thirst if used in its Thirsty Form is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals some HP and Stress Damage while Moving the Manservant Forward.

The Manservant must have 33% or less HP in order to use this Attack on Apprentice Difficulty and a Higher Chance to use it if it has 55% or less HP on Veteran & Champion Difficulty

This Attack has a 31% Chance to Inflict the Crimson Curse alongside a Chance to apply a Hefty + Stress Debuff to the Target Hero.

In addition, the Manservant Heals some HP & Receives any Blight that was on the Target Hero and changes into its Bloodlust Form.
Overall Analysis
The Manservant is a Low HP Enemy with High Speed and Dodge that supports its Allies by Guarding them whilst Disrupting your Heroes with Pulls and Stuns and inflicting Stress to your Heroes.

The Manservant doesn't do much Damage Overall, instead it opts to take up more of a supporting role, Guarding its Allies in both Forms with Infallible Servitude and Gibbering Entourage.

In addition, the Manservant uses Attacks such as Enraging Slight and Refined Palate to inflict Stress to your Heroes alongside Disrupting your Heroes.

As is the case with most of the Crimson Court Enemies, The Thirst is used to Heal Themselves while dealing HP and Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside having a Chance to inflict the Crimson Curse.

It should be noted that the Version of The Thirst that the Manservant can use in its Thirsty Form can inflict a Large + Stress Debuff to the Target Hero (+33% on Apprentice // +50% on Veteran // +67% on Champion)

While the Manservant isn't as directly threatening as some of the other Crimson Court Enemies, they do a good job of being a hinderance by Guarding their Allies and dealing Stress to your Heroes.

It can be a good idea to kill them early on or use Stuns to shut the Manservant down whilst you take care of other threats.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Manservant (Bloodlust)
Ruins Weald

Refined Palate

Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
42.85% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
42.85% Chance to Target Marked Hero
