75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Gibbering Entourage
1.0 Base Chance to be used if 2+ Non Guarded Monsters
and at least 3 Monsters are Present
The Thirst
5.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 33%
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Refined Palate is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that is used by the Manservant in its Bloodlust Form.

This Attack deals minimal HP Damage and some Stress Damage to the Target Hero alongside being able to Stun them as well.

Gibbering Entourage is a Support Skill used by the Manservant in its Bloodlust Form to Guard all of its Allies while Greatly Buffing its Prot to make itself much more durable.

Choice Cut is a Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals Low Damage alongside a Bleed to a Hero in the Back 2 Positions.

The Thirst if used in its Bloodlust Form is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals mediocre HP Damage and some Stress Damage while Moving the Manservant Forward.

The Manservant must have 33% or less HP in order to use this Attack.

This Attack has a 31% Chance to Inflict the Crimson Curse alongside Healing some HP & Recieving any Blight that was on the Target Hero.

Unlike when used in its Thirsty Form, The Thirst Applies an Accuracy and Speed Debuff to the Manservant.
Overall Analysis
The Manservant is a Low HP Enemy with High Speed and Dodge that supports its Allies by Guarding them whilst Disrupting your Heroes with Pulls and Stuns and inflicting Stress to your Heroes.

The Manservant doesn't do much Damage Overall, instead it opts to take up more of a supportingg role, Guarding its Allies in both Forms with Infallible Servitude and Gibbering Entourage.

In addition, the Manservant uses Attacks such as Enraging Slight and Refined Palate to inflict Stress to your Heroes alongside Disrupting your Heroes.

As is the case with most of the Crimson Court Enemies, The Thirst is used to Heal Themselves while dealing HP and Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside having a Chance to inflict the Crimson Curse.

While the Manservant isn't as directly threatening as some of the other Crimson Court Enemies, they do a good job of being a hinderance by Guarding their Allies and dealing Stress to your Heroes.

It can be a good idea to kill them early on or use Stuns to shut the Manservant down whilst you take care of other threats.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Sycophant
Ruins Weald
Cove Warrens
Courtyard
Farmstead X
The AI Behavior and Skills of the Sycophant in its Bloodlust Form are covered in a separate Section.
Cooldowns
Maddening Whine - 1 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Maddening Whine
2.0 Base Chance to be used if 2+ Non Stunned Heroes Present
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
50% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
33.3% Chance to Target Marked Hero
The Thirst
1.0 Base Chance to be used
5.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 40%
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Veteran & Champion
Maddening Whine
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
42.85% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
42.85% Chance to Target Marked Hero
The Thirst
1.0 Base Chance to be used
5.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 40%
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Maddening Whine is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals minimal HP Damage alongside a Decent amount of Stress Damage while Moving the Sycophant Back.

The Thirst if used in its Thirsty Form is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Low HP Damage and some Stress Damage while Moving the Sycophant Forward.

The Sycophant has a much Higher Chance to use this Attack if its HP is at 40% or Lower.

This Attack has a 31% Chance to Inflict the Crimson Curse to the Target Hero and grants the Sycophant a Buff to its Stun Skill Chance.

In addition, the Sycophant Heals some HP & Receives any Blight that was on the Target Hero and changes into its Bloodlust Form.
Overall Analysis
The Sycophant is a Low HP Enemy with High Speed and Dodge that deals overall mediocre Damage , mainly inflicting Stress Damage with its Attacks.

It can also use Deafening Whine in order to Stun your Heroes and dish out some Bleeds using Bombing Run.

As is the case with most of the Crimson Court Enemies, The Thirst is used to Heal Themselves while dealing HP and Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside having a Chance to inflict the Crimson Curse.

While the Sycophant isn't as much of a threat as some of the other Crimson Court Enemies, they can still be troublesome due to their High Speed and Dodge which lets them act quickly and evade your Attacks.

Using a Hero with High Speed to Outspeed and Stun the Sycophant can be effective, in addition to taking advantage of their Low HP and killing them outright.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Sycophant (Bloodlust)
Ruins Weald
Cove Warrens
Courtyard
Farmstead X
The AI Behavior and Skills of the Sycophant in its Thirsty Form are covered in a separate Section.
Cooldowns
All Difficulties
Deafening Whine - 1 rd Cooldown

The Thirst - 2 rd Cooldown

The Thirst - 1 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Deafening Whine
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
The Thirst
2.0 Base Chance to be used
6.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 30%
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Bombing Run
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran & Champion
Deafening Whine
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
The Thirst
2.0 Base Chance to be used
8.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 30%
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Bombing Run
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Deafening Whine is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals minimal HP Damage and minor Stress Damage while Moving the Sycophant Back.

This Attack takes advantage of the Stun Skill Chance Buff the Sycophant gains by using The Thirst in its Thirsty Form, which makes up for its relatively Low Stun Chance.

Bombing Run is an Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Mediocre Damage to 1 or 2 Heroes alongside Bleed.

The Thirst if used in its Bloodlust Form is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Decent Damage and Stress while Moving the Sycophant Forward.

The Sycophant has a much Higher Chance to use this Skill if its HP is at 30% or Lower.

This Attack also has a 31% Chance to Inflict the Crimson Curse alongside Healing some HP & Recieving any Blight that was on the Target Hero.

Unlike in its Thirsty Form, The Thirst Applies an Accuracy and Speed Debuff to the Sycophant.
Overall Analysis
The Sycophant is a Low HP Enemy with High Speed and Dodge that can prove to be quite the nuisance.

The Sycophant does overall mediocre Damage, mainly dishing out Stress with its Attacks. It can also use Deafening Whine in order to Stun your Heroes and dish out some Bleeds using Bombing Run.

As is the case with most of the Crimson Court Enemies, The Thirst is used to Heal Themselves while dealing HP and Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside having a Chance to inflict the Crimson Curse.

While they are not as Threatening as some of the other Crimson Court Enemies, the Sycophant can still be troublesome due to their High Speed and Dodge which lets them act quickly and evade your Attacks.

The best way to deal with them is by Stunning them with a Faster Hero to shut them down for a turn or taking advantage of their Low HP by taking them out early on.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Esquire
Courtyard
Farmstead X
The AI Behavior and Skills of the Esquire in its Bloodlust Form are covered in a separate Section.
Cooldowns
Skewering Repartee - 2 rd Cooldown
The Thirst - 1 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to use Random Skill
Rib Cracker
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
11.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
91.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skewering Repartee
3.0 Base Chance to be used
The Thirst
1.0 Base Chance to be used
11.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 50%
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Rib Cracker is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable in the Front 2 Ranks that deals Mediocre Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks.

This Attack has a 91% Chance to Target Marked Heroes and can Push a Frontline Hero Back and Debuff their Speed.

More importantly, the Esquire moves Back into the Back Ranks where he can use his highly threatening Skill, Skewering Repartee.

Skewering Repartee is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable in the Back 2 Ranks that Deals High Damage with Bleed to your Entire Party alongside Activating the Esquire's Riposte.

The Thirst if used in its Thirsty Form is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals some Damage and Stress while Moving the Esquire Forward.

The Esquire has a much Higher Chance to use this Skill if its HP is at 50% or Lower.

This Attack has a 45% Chance to Inflict the Crimson Curse alongside Healing some HP & Recieving any Blight that was on the Target Hero.

The Thirst Applies an Accuracy and Speed Debuff to the Esquire and Clears its Riposte.
Overall Analysis
The Esquire is an Enemy that can potentially dish out Large Amounts of Damage alongside being able to Support its Allies in its Bloodlust Form.

The Esquire can deal a Large Amount of Damage if it is allowed to act in the Back 2 Ranks, being able to use Skewering Repartee in its Thirsty Form and Piercing Foreleg in its Bloodlust Form.

Unlike in its Thirsty Form where it mostly does its own thing, the Esquire provides Support to its Allies by Marking Heroes using Needling Execration and inflicting a Bleed Resist Debuff with Piercing Foreleg.

As is the case with most of the Crimson Court Enemies, The Thirst is used to Heal Themselves while dealing HP and Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside having a Chance to inflict the Crimson Curse.

Due to the Esquire being so threatening in the Back 2 Ranks, you want to prioritize not letting the Esquire act in the Back 2 Ranks, which can happen due to the Esquire Moving Back by itself or other Enemies Moving Forward

Stuns are useful for shutting down the Esquire for a turn, giving your Heroes more time to use displacing Skills to Move the Esquire to the Front Ranks or outright kill it.

Eliminating the Enemies accompanying the Esquire can also be effective since once only 2 Enemies are left the Esquire will be stranded in the Front 2 Positions.

Overall Threat Level: Borderline High

Esquire (Bloodlust)
Courtyard
Farmstead X
The AI Behavior and Skills of the Esquire in its Thirsty Form are covered in a separate Section.
Cooldowns
The Thirst - 4 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to use Random Skill
Needling Execration
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
80% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Piercing Foreleg
2.0 Base Chance to be used
The Thirst
1.0 Base Chance to be used
11.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 50%
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Needling Execration is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable in the Front 3 Ranks that deals Mediocre HP Damage and some Stress Damage alongside inflicting Bleed to a Target Hero in the Front 3 Positions.

This Attack applies a Mark to the Target Hero, which helps many Crimson Court Enemies that have a Higher Chance to Target Marked Heroes focus down the Marked Hero

More importantly, when using this Attack the Esquire moves Back into the Back Ranks where he can use his highly threatening Skill, Piercing Foreleg.

Piercing Foreleg is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable in the Back 2 Ranks that deals High Damage to your Entire Party.

This Attack also inflicts a Bleed Resist Debuff that synergizes with the Bleed Heavy Crimson Court Enemies.

The Thirst if used in its Bloodlust Form is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Decent HP and Stress Damage while Moving the Esquire Forward.

The Esquire has a much Higher Chance to use this Skill if its HP is at 50% or Lower.

This Attack also has a 45% Chance to Inflict the Crimson Curse alongside Healing some HP & Recieving any Blight that was on the Target Hero.

The Thirst Applies an Accuracy and Speed Debuff to the Esquire.
Overall Analysis
The Esquire is an Enemy that can potentially dish out Large Amounts of Damage alongside being able to Support its Allies in its Bloodlust Form.

The Esquire can deal a Large Amount of Damage if it is allowed to act in the Back 2 Ranks, being able to use Skewering Repartee in its Thirsty Form and Piercing Foreleg in its Bloodlust Form.

Unlike in its Thirsty Form where it mostly does its own thing, the Esquire provides Support to its Allies by Marking Heroes using Needling Execration and inflicting a Bleed Resist Debuff with Piercing Foreleg.

As is the case with most of the Crimson Court Enemies, The Thirst is used to Heal Themselves while dealing HP and Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside having a Chance to inflict the Crimson Curse.

Due to the Esquire being so threatening in the Back 2 Ranks, you want to prioritize not letting the Esquire act in the Back 2 Ranks, which can happen due to the Esquire Moving Back by itself or other Enemies Moving Forward

Stuns are useful for shutting down the Esquire for a turn, giving your Heroes more time to use displacing Skills to Move the Esquire to the Front Ranks or outright kill it.

Eliminating the Enemies accompanying the Esquire can also be effective since once only 2 Enemies are left the Esquire will be stranded in the Front 2 Positions.

Overall Threat Level: Borderline High

Courtesan
Courtyard
Farmstead X
The AI Behavior and Skills of the Courtesan in its Bloodlust Form are covered in a separate Section.
Cooldowns
Midnight Minuet - 4 rd Cooldown
Careless Whispers - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to use Random Skill
Careless Whispers
12.0 Base Chance to be used
Midnight Minuet
24.0 Base Chance to be used if 3+ Monsters Present
Mind Your Manners
3.0 Base Chance to be used
Damsel In Distress
12.0 Base Chance to be used if no Guarded Monsters Present
The Thirst
8.0 Base Chance to be used
44.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 60%
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Careless Whispers is a High Accuracy AoE Attack usable from the Back 3 Ranks that deals minimal HP Damage while inflicting Horror and an Accuracy Debuff to all of your Heroes.

Midnight Minuet is a Support Skill used by the Courtesan that Shuffles the entire Enemy Party while giving them a hefty Speed and Damage Buff that lasts for 3 Turns while Debuffing their Accuracy for a Turn

Mind Your Manners is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Mediocre Damage while Marking the Target Hero.

Damsel In Distress is a Support Skill used by the Courtesan that Forces an Ally to Guard the Courtesan while Buffing said Ally with a large amount of Prot to make them Tankier

The Thirst if used in its Thirsty Form is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals some HP and Stress Damage while Moving the Courtesan Forward.

The Courtesan has a much Higher Chance to use this Skill if its HP is at 60% or Lower.

This Attack has a 45% Chance to Inflict the Crimson Curse and grants the Courtesan a Hefty Dodge Buff.

In addition, the Courtesan Heals some HP & Receives any Blight that was on the Target Hero alongside changing into its Bloodlust Form.
Overall Analysis
The Courtesan is a relatively Low HP Enemy with High Speed and Decent Dodge which can prove to be quite the nuisance by spreading Stress, Buffing their Allies, and Marking your Heroes.

The Courtesan doesn't deal much Damage Overall, instead Buffing their allies with Midnight Minuet & Damsel in Distress or using Skills such as Careless Whispers and Renewed Appetite to inflict Stress to your Heroes.

In addition, the Courtesan has Attacks that Mark Heroes in both Forms, helping the many Crimson Court Enemies which have a Higher Chance to Target Marked Heroes focus down the Marked Hero.

As is the case with most of the Crimson Court Enemies, The Thirst is used to Heal Themselves while dealing HP and Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside having a Chance to inflict the Crimson Curse.

While The Courtesan isn't as threatening as some of the other Crimson Court Enemies, they can still be troublesome due to their High Speed alongside their ability to Support their Allies and deal Stress Damage to your Heroes.

It is usually a good idea to attempt to take them out quickly, although there will be times where other Enemies take priority over them, in which case Stuns can be good to shut them down while your Heroes deal with the other threats.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Courtesan (Bloodlust)
Courtyard
Farmstead X
The AI Behavior and Skills of the Courtesan in its Thirsty Form are covered in a separate Section.

Skill Breakdown
Renewed Appetite is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Mediocre HP Damage and some Stress Damage alongside inflicting Blight.

Expose the Vein is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Very Low Damage while Marking the Target Hero.

This Attack also inflicts a Bleed Resist Debuff and a tiny Prot Debuff that synergizes with the Bleed Heavy Crimson Court Enemies.

The Thirst if used in its Bloodlust Form is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Decent HP and Stress Damage while Moving the Courtesan Forward.

The Courtesan has a much Higher Chance to use this Skill if its HP is at 50% or Lower.

This Attack has a 45% Chance to Inflict the Crimson Curse alongside letting the Courtesan Heal some HP & Receive any Blight that was on the Target Hero.

Unlike in its Thirsty Form, The Thirst Applies an Accuracy and Speed Debuff to the Courtesan.
Overall Analysis
The Courtesan is a relatively Low HP Enemy with High Speed and Decent Dodge which can prove to be quite the nuisance by spreading Stress, Buffing their Allies, and Marking your Heroes.

The Courtesan doesn't deal much Damage Overall, instead Buffing their allies with Midnight Minuet & Damsel in Distress or using Skills such as Careless Whispers and Renewed Appetite to inflict Stress to your Heroes.

In addition, the Courtesan has Attacks that Mark Heroes in both Forms, helping the many Crimson Court Enemies which have a Higher Chance to Target Marked Heroes focus down the Marked Hero.

As is the case with most of the Crimson Court Enemies, The Thirst is used to Heal Themselves while dealing HP and Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside having a Chance to inflict the Crimson Curse.

While The Courtesan isn't as threatening as some of the other Crimson Court Enemies, they can still be troublesome due to their High Speed alongside their ability to Support their Allies and deal Stress Damage to your Heroes.

It is usually a good idea to attempt to take them out quickly, although there will be times where other Enemies take priority over them, in which case Stuns can be good to shut them down while your Heroes deal with the other threats.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Crystalline Aberration
Farmstead
All Difficulties
All Skills
2.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Unstable Resonance
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
60% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Explosive Undoing
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Unstable Resonance
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Explosive Undoing
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Champion / Endless
Unstable Resonance
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
5.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
71.4% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Explosive Undoing
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Unstable Resonance is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Very High HP Damage and some Stress Damage alongside some Blight to the Hero.
Explosive Undoing is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack usable from any Position that hits all 4 Heroes, dealing Relatively Low HP Damage alongside inflicting Horror.
Overall Analysis
The Crystalline Aberration can spawn from Enemy Corpses and has a miniscule HP Pool, literally negative Dodge and Speed and High Resists against Bleeds, Stuns, and Debuffs.

Your Heroes get a Minor HP Heal if they kill a Crystalline Aberration (2 HP on Apprentice // 4 HP on Veteran // 5 HP on Champion / Endless)

Due to the Attacks the Crystalline Aberration can use being quite threatening alongside the ease of eliminating them, it is a good idea to get rid of the Crystalline Aberration.

Overall Threat Level: Low

Farmhand
Farmstead
Cooldowns
Pause from Labor - 2 rd Cooldown

Skill Breakdown
Sow the Seeds is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minimal HP Damage and a hefty amount of Stress Damage alongside inflicting Blight to the Target Hero.

Ceaseless Labor is a Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals Mediocre Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks.

Pause from Labor is a Skill the Farmhand can use if their HP is Low enough to Heal itself and Buff its Speed.
Overall Analysis
The Farmhand is a Relatively Low HP Enemy with Decent Dodge that can inflict Stress and Blight with Sow the Seeds alongside some Damage with Ceaseless Labor.

The Farmhand isn't much of a threat thanks its Low Damage output, although the Stress Damage Sow the Seeds inflicts can be a concern.

Although the Farmhand isn't very threatening, the nature of the Endless Harvest alongside the Relatively Low HP of the Farmhand makes them good to kill if you can.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Scarecrow
Farmstead
Cooldowns
Apprentice / Veteran
Haunting Revelation - 2 rd Cooldown
Endless
Haunting Revelation - 1 rd Cooldown
Roots - 6 rd Cooldown
Shard of Growth - 3 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Flail the Crops
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Haunting Revelation
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Flail the Crops
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Haunting Revelation
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Endless
Flail the Crops
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Haunting Revelation
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Roots
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Shard of Growth
1.0 Base Chance to be used if 3+ Monsters Present
Skill Breakdown
Haunting Revelation is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Very Low Damage alongside some Horror to a Target Hero.

Flail the Crops is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals Decent Damage alongside Blight to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks.

Roots is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals Low Damage alongside a - Speed and - Accuracy Debuff to a Hero in the Back 3 Ranks.

Shard of Growth is a Support Skill the Scarecrow uses to give their Allies Restoration, Healing them over time.
Overall Analysis
The Scarecrow is an Enemy with High Speed and Dodge alongside a Very High Bleed Resist and a High Stun Resist that can Inflict Horror and Blight on Apprentice/Veteran Levels.

The Scarecrow gains the ability to Debuff your Heroes with Roots and Heal their allies with Shard of Growth during the Endless Harvest.

The Scarecrow enters the Battle with 2 Turns of Stealth on any Difficulty, making them harder to eliminate.

The Scarecrow doesn't pose much of a threat with many of its Attacks dealing minimal Damage outside of Flail the Crops.

Since the Scarecrow isn't very threatening, it is better to get rid of other Enemies that will continue to spawn during the Endless Harvest unless you have a good way to take it out.

Overall Threat Level: Medium Low

Sleeper's Herald
Farmstead
Reality Bend
All Difficulties
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Veteran
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Endless
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Reality Bend is a High Accuracy Attack usable from any Position that can Target 1 or 2 Heroes in Any Position, dealing Minimal HP Damage alongside some Minor Stress Damage.

This Attack can inflict several Debuffs such as - Healing Received, - Accuracy, and Random Target Chance to Target Heroes.

Its Riposte attack similarly has Very Low Damage and Crit Chance and has a relatively Low Chance to inflict a + Stress Debuff to the Attacking Hero.
Overall Analysis
The Sleeper's Herald is a Very Low HP Enemy with Low Speed, High Prot and overall High Resistances that has a Permanent Riposte Active.

The Sleeper's Herald is more annoying than anything due to it dealing next to no actual HP Damage, making them a Low Priority to get rid of.

Due to the Sleeper's Herald having High Prot, Bleed Resist, and Blight Resist, Armor Piercing is the best way to kill them.

Overall Threat Level: Low

Foreman
Farmstead
Cooldowns
Stir The Rabble - 2 rd Cooldown
Many Hands - 2 rd Cooldown
All Difficulties
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
No Trespassers
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Many Hands
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Stir The Rabble
Used as an Auto Action if Farmhand is Present
Targetting Desire
Targets Farmhands
Skill Breakdown
No Trespassers is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack without Positioning or Targettng Requirements that deals High Damage and a Bleed alongside a + Stress Debuff to the Target Hero.

This Attack also Marks the Target Hero, helping other Enemies who have a High Chance to Target Marked Heroes such as the Scarecrow and Farmhand focus the Marked Hero.

Stir The Rabble is a Support Skill that is used at the start of a Round as a Free Action if a Farmhand is present, granting them a Buff to their Blight Skill Chance, Blight Duration, and Speed.

This Skill also activates the Riposte of the Target Farmhand, letting it strike back at Heroes who Attack it.

Many Hands is a Support Skill that is used to give an Ally a Buff to their Speed and Prot.
Overall Analysis
The Foreman is a Relatively High HP Enemy with overall Low Resists that can deal High Damage and Bleed with No Trespassers and Buffs their Allies with their other 2 Skills.

The Foreman is the only Enemy in the game to get a Buff from an Enemy spawning in, gaining a Speed Buff with each Farmhand that spawns to join the battle.

The Foreman can prove to be troublesome if you are not ready to deal with No Trespassers, which deals quite a bit of Damage and helps other Enemies focus down a Hero.

Due to the Foreman having a Low Stun Resist Stat, Stuns can be effective at shutting it down for a turn, giving your party more room to breathe.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Plow Horse
Farmstead
Cooldowns
Rearing Strike - 1 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Apprentice
Paw the Ground
4.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 35%
Trample
Guarenteed to be used if Paw the Ground has been used.
Rearing Strike
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Bestial Scream
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Veteran
Paw the Ground
4.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 35%
Trample
1000.0 Base Chance to be used if Paw the Ground has been used
Rearing Strike
2.0 Base Chance to be used if at least 2 Non Stunned Heroes
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
75% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Bestial Scream
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Endless
Paw the Ground
4.0 Base Chance to be used if Own HP 35%
Trample
1000.0 Base Chance to be used if Paw the Ground has been used
Rearing Strike
2.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
80% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Bestial Scream
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Paw the Ground is a Skill the Plow Horse uses to Move itself into the Back Ranks while giving itself Stealth to get ready to use Trample.

Trample is a High Accuracy AoE Attack usable from any Position that deals Damage to all 4 of your Heroes alongside Shuffling them.

This Attack can only be used if Paw the Ground has been used, regardless of whether it is Stealthed or not.

Rearing Strike is a Decently Accurate Attack usable from any Position that deals Decent Damage alongside inflicting a Bleed and a potential Stun to 1 or 2 Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks.

This Attack has a Chance to Target both Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks from Veteran Difficulty onwards.

Bestial Scream is a Very Accurate Single Target Attack without any Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Minor Stress Damage to the Target Hero.
Overall Analysis
The Plow Horse is a Low HP Size 2 Enemy with High Speed and some Prot that can disrupt your entire party with Trample and Spread Stuns and Bleed to your Frontline using Rearing Strike.

The Plow Horse is the only Enemy that can use a Skill to become Stealthed.

The main threat the Plow Horse poses is its ability to disrupt your entire Party if the Plow Horse is allowed to use Trample.

The best way to deal with the Plow Horse is having a Hero that is fast enough to Outspeed and Stun the Plow Horse, preventing it from using Paw the Ground and giving your Heroes more time to dispatch it.

Doing enough Damage to the Plow Horse to get it below 35% of its Max HP can also be effective since this prevents the Plow Horse from using Paw the Ground entirely.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Sleeper's Dream
Farmstead
Enemy Overview
The Sleeper's Dream appears once you have earned 10 Enemy Kills. If you have killed more than 10 Enemies, the Excess gets carried over to the next wave, making you need to score less than 10 Kills to end the wave.

Its sole purpose is to use Beyond Time and Space to Teleport your party into a room at the end of a wave.

Rapturous Cultist
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 1-2
Farmstead X
Cooldowns
Flesh Wall - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
10.0 Base Chance to Target Cultist Priest
Darkest
Flesh Wall
3.0 Base Chance to be used if there are No Guarded Monsters
13.0 Base Chance to be used if there are No Guarded Monsters
and there is a Cultist Priest Present
Targetting Desire
91% Chance to Target Cultist Priest if one is Present
Flesh to Flesh
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
4.0 Base Chance to Target Monster with Lowest HP %
66.7% Chance to Target Cultist Priests if one is Present
26.7% Chance to Target Monster with Lowest HP %
Skill Breakdown
Flesh Wall is a Support Skill the Rapturous Cultist uses to Guard an Ally, protecting them from harm.

This Skill is very Likely to Target a Cultist Priest if any are Present and isn't used if there are any Enemies being Guarded.

Flesh to Flesh is a Support Skill used by the Rapturous Cultist to Heal an Ally.

This Skill is very Likely to Target a Cultist Priest if any are Present or the Ally alongside having a Chance to Target the Ally with the Lowest HP %.
Overall Analysis
The Rapturous Cultist is a Low HP Enemy with High Speed that uses its 2 Skills to Guard and Heal its Allies. It can be encountered during the First and Second Darkest Dungeon Missions.

While the Rapturous Cultist cannot harm your Party Directly, it poses an indirect threat by supporting the many dangerous Enemies present in the Darkest Dungeon.

In particular, it has a Very High Chance to Target a Cultist Priest with its Skills, which is a problem due to Cultist Priests being quite the threat.

Stuns are very useful for dealing with the Rapturous Cultist since it Breaks its Guard while dealing little Damage to the Rapturous Cultist itself and stopping it from acting for a turn.

The reason why you don't want to be killing the Rapturous Cultist is that they are very good to have as the last Enemy while you stall to Heal your Party up.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Ascended Brawler
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 1
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Rend for the New God
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
5.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
83.3% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Stumbling Scratch
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Rend for the New God is a relatively Low Damage Single Target Attack with a High Crit Chance that inflicts a larger amount of Bleed compared to Rend for the Old Gods.

It is usable from the Front 2 Ranks while being able to Target Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks and Moves the Ascended Brawler Forward.

This Attack benefits from a +50% Damage Buff when Targetting Marked Heroes and can apply a + Stress Debuff to your Heroes, which synergizes with their High Crit Chance and the Ascended Witches that will likely be accompanying them.

Stumbling Scratch is a Low Accuracy Single Target Repositioning Attack usable in the Back 2 Positions that deals Low Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions while Moving the Ascended Brawler Forward.
Overall Analysis
The Ascended Brawler is the Darkest Level version of the Cultist Brawler with Slightly Better Stats and Skills overall. It can be encountered during the First Darkest Dungeon Mission.

The Ascended Brawler doesn't pose much of a threat compared to other Darkest Dungeon Mobs, with Rend for the New God dealing Decent at best Damage even to Marked Targets.

It should also be noted that Ascended Brawlers can only Target Heroes in the Front 2 Ranks, making them very predictable and easy to deal with.

Stunning the Ascended Brawler or Moving it to Back 2 Positions is a good way to shut down the Ascended Brawler.

Due to these factors, it is usually better to take out the bigger threats that accompany the Ascended Brawler.

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Ascended Witch
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 1
Cooldowns
Fate's Push - 3 rd Cooldown
Fate's Pull - 3 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Fate's Reveal
Unless All 4 Heroes are Virtued or 2+ Marked Heroes are Present
3.0 Base Chance to be used
23.0 Base Chance to be used as First Action
Targetting Desire
10.0 Base Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
91% Chance to Target Most Stressed Hero
Fate's Push
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Fate's Pull
1.0 Base Chance to be used
11.0 Base Chance to be used as Second Action
Targetting Desire
10.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
91% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Fate's Reveal is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals minimal HP Damage and a hefty amount of Stress Damage to the Target Hero alongside Lowering the Light Level..

This Attack also applies a Mark to the Target Hero that lasts for the entire Battle, helping the many Enemies who have a bias towards Targetting Marked Heroes or have a Bonus vs Marked Targets focus down the Marked Hero.

It should be noted that this Attack has a massive 91% Chance to Target the most Stressed Hero, which can lead to them being focused down by Stress Damage, resulting in a potential Affliction.

Fate's Pull is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals Minimal HP Damage and Minor Stress Damage to the Target Hero in the Back 2 Positions while Pulling them Forward.

This Attack has a Very High (91%) Chance to Target Marked Heroes to bring to the front for Monsters that benefit from Targetting Marked Targets or have a higher chance to Target Marked Heroes can focus down the Marked Hero, which will likely be a relatively flimsy Backline Hero.

Fate's Push is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from all positions that deals Minimal HP Damage and Minor Stress Damage to the Target Hero in the Front 2 Positions while Pushing them Back.
Overall Analysis
The Ascended Witch is the Darkest Level version of the Cultist Acolyte with Slightly Better Stats and Skills overall. It can be encountered during the First Darkest Dungeon Mission.

Due to the Ascended Witch being able to deal hefty Stress Damage to your Heroes alongside Marking them and the disruption they can cause, it is in your best interest to eliminate it quickly.

It is preferrable to have a Hero who can Outspeed the Ascended Witch and Stun them to shut them down for the turn, giving the other Heroes time to finish them off quickly.

Overall Threat Level: High

Cultist Priest
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 1-2
Cooldowns
The Finger - 1 rd Cooldown
All Skills
3.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Death Lash
1.0 Base Chance to be used
The Finger
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
25% Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
Skill Breakdown
Death Lash is a High Accuracy AoE Attack usable from any Position that deals some HP Damage and Minor Stress Damage to both Heroes in the Front 2 Positions alongside inflicting a - Bleed Resist Debuff.

The Bleed Resist Debuff that this Attack inflicts synergizes well with the Bleed Heavy Enemies in the First 2 Floors of the Darkest Dungeon.

The Finger is a High Accuracy and Crit Chance Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Decently High HP Damage and hefty Stress Damage alongside a nasty Bleed to the Target Hero.

Despite the Cultist Priest not having a Higher Chance to do so, this Attack benefits from a +50% Damage Buff when Targetting a Marked Hero
Overall Analysis
The Cultist Priest is a Decently Fast Enemy that deals HP and Stress Damage with both of its Attacks, with The Finger being notable due to its High Crit Chance and nasty Bleed. It can be encountered during the First and Second Darkest Dungeon Missions.

The Cultist Priest is a threatening Enemy that applies a hefty amount of offensive pressure using its Attacks.

It is made more dangerous due to Rapturous Cultist Enemies having a Higher Chance to support the Cultist Priest by Guarding or Healing them.

Due to the Cultist Priest being such a threat, you want to get rid of them as quickly as possible and use Stuns to keep them in check.

It should be noted that The Finger has a 1 turn Cooldown and cannot be used consecutively.

Overall Threat Level: High

Defensive Growth
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 2
Cooldowns
Grand Guard - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Grand Guard
5.0 Base Chance to be used if there are No Guarded Monsters
Bolster
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Ritualic Restoration
3.0 Base Chance to be used if any Ally Monster HP % 50%
Targetting Desire
3.0 Base Chance to Target Monster with Lowest HP %
75% Chance to Target Monster with Lowest HP %
Unbearable Tremors
1.0 Base Chance to be used if last Monster remaining
Skill Breakdown
Grand Guard is a Support Skill used by the Defensive Growth to Guard an Ally while Buffing itself with more Prot and has a High Chance to be used if no Enemies are being Guarded.

Bolster is used by the Defensive Growth to give an Ally a hefty Buff to their Speed, Accuracy, and Crit Chance.

Ritualic Restoration is used by the Defensive Growth to Heal an Ally if there are any Allies with 50% or less HP.

This Skill has a 75% Chance to be used on the Ally with the Lowest HP %.

Unbearable Tremors is a High Accuracy AoE Attack with High Accuracy usable from any Position that deals some Stress Damage to all 4 of your Heroes.

This Attack is only used if the Defensive Growth is the last Enemy remaining, making it harder for players to Stall on it.
Overall Analysis
The Defensive Growth is a High HP Enemy with High Speed that uses its Skills to Guard, Buff, and Heal its Allies. It can be encountered during the Second darkest dungeon Mission, alongside Malignant Growths.

While the Defensive Growth cannot harm your Party Directly, it poses an indirect threat by supporting its High Threat Enemies.

Although it may seem like you should prioritize dealing with other Enemies that pose a direct threat to your Heroes, it is usually better to get rid of the Defensive Growth first due to it supporting its Allies well.

Overall Threat Level: High

Malignant Growth
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 1-2
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
4.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
Darkest
Maul the Flesh
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
28.6% Chance to Target Lowest Bleed Resist Hero
57.1% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Daze the Mind
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
2.0 Base Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
28.6% Chance to Target Lowest Stun Resist Non Stunned Hero
57.1% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Maul the Flesh is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack with no Positioning or Targetting Requirements that deals Decently High Damage alongside a Bleed to the Target Hero.
Daze the Mind is a Very Accurate Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals Mediocre Damage alongside to a Target Hero in the Front 2 Positions alongside potentially Stunning them.
Overall Analysis
The Malignant Growth is a High HP Enemy with a Very High Stun and Move Resist Stat that Stuns your Heroes using Daze the Mind and Bleeds Your Heroes using Maul the Flesh. It can be encountered during the First and Second Darkest Dungeon Missions.

The Malignant Growth is a threatening Enemy that is particularly threatening due to Maul the Flesh being able to deal Hefty Damage with a Bleed.

It should be noted that Maul the Flesh has a Higher Chance to Target Heroes with the Lowest Bleed Resist and Daze the Mind has a Higher Chance to Target Non Stunned Heroes with the Lowest Stun Resist.

In addition, the Malignant Growth has a 57% Chance to Target Marked Heroes with both of its Attacks

Although the Malignant Growth is certainly a threat that you want to get rid of, due to it being difficult to deal with quickly it can be a better call to focus on other threats that you can take care of more quickly.

Stuns are very useful for keeping the Malignant Growth in check and limiting its Damage Output.

Overall Threat Level: High

Flesh Hound
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 2-3
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Gnash
2.0 Base Chance to be used
12.0 Base Chance to be used if Marked Hero is Present
Targetting Desire
5.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
83.3% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Fetch
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Nibble
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Gnash is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Decent HP Damage and Minor Stress Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Positions.

This Attack also benefits from a +50% Damage Buff when Targetting Marked Heroes alongside an 83% Chance to Target Marked Heroes to complement it.

Fetch is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Mediocre Damage to a Hero in any Position alongside potentially Pulling and Stunning them.

Nibble is a Low Accuracy Repositioning Attack used from Position 4 that deals Minimal Damage to a Hero in any Position while Moving the Flesh Hound Forward to Position 1.
Overall Analysis
The Flesh Hound is a High Speed Enemy that deals HP and Stress Damage using Gnash and disrupts your Heroes using Fetch. It can be encountered during the Second and Third Darkest Dungeon Missions.

The Flesh Hound can be troublesome due to Gnash being able to deal hefty Damage to Marked Heroes and Fetch being a Highly disruptive Attack.

The Flesh Hound should be prioritized if paired with Polyps due to the Flesh Hound dealing the bulk of the Damage between the 2 Enemies alongside the fact that Polyps are rendered completely powerless if left as the final Enemy unlike the Flesh Hound

Stuns are useful for shutting down the Flesh Hound for a turn and limiting its Damage Output.

Moving the Flesh Hound to Position 4 is a good way to shut it down since it'll be forced to use Nibble, a Very Weak Repositioning Attack.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High

Polyp
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 2-3
Cooldowns
Venomous Phlegm - 2 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Venomous Phlegm
1.0 Base Chance to be used if no Heroes are Marked
11.0 Base Chance to be used Turn 1 if no Heroes are Marked
Banish
2.0 Base Chance to be used if at least 3 Heroes are Present
Violent Hack
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Venomous Phlegm is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable from the Back 3 Positions that deals Mediocre Damage and a Hefty Blight to a Hero in the Back 3 Positions on top of Marking them as well.

The Polyp has a 91% Chance to use this Attack as its first action if no Heroes are Marked.

This Attack Marking a Hero helps the Flesh Hound and Antibody focus their attacks onto the Marked Hero.

Banish is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from the Front 3 Positions that deals Middling Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Ranks, potentially Knocking them Back to the Back 2 Ranks.

Violent Hack is a Low Accuracy Single Target Repositioning Attack used if the Polyp is at Position 1 that deals Minimal Damage to a Hero in the Front 2 Positions while Moving itself to the Back 2 Ranks.
Overall Analysis
The Polyp is a Backline Enemy with Very High Speed and High Dodge that Blights and Marks your Heroes using Venomous Phlegm in addition to dirupting them using Banish. It can be encountered during the Second and Third Darkest Dungeon Missions.

Although the Polyp can be a nusiance by Marking your Heroes or disrupting them, they don't deal much Damage, making them a relatively low threat Enemy.

Due to this, you are usually better off dealing with the more threatening Enemies such as the Flesh Hound and Antibody first while mostly ignoring the Polyp.

Moving the Polyp to Position 1 is a good way to shut it down as it will be forced to use Violent Hack, a Very Weak Repositioning Attack.

Overall Threat Level: Medium

Antibody
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 3
Darkest
Stunning Secretion
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Targetting Desire
1.0 Base Chance to be Target Random Hero
2.0 Base Chance to Target Marked Hero
66.7% Chance to Target Marked Hero
Skill Breakdown
Stunning Secretion is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from any Position that deals High Damage alongside potentially Stunning a Hero in the Front 3 Positions.
This Attack cannot Crit and has a 66.7% Chance to Target Marked Heroes.
Overall Analysis
The Antibody is a Decently Fast Enemy that uses Stunning Secretion to deal hefty Damage to a Hero while also Stunning them. It can be encountered during the Third Darkest Dungeon Mission.

The Antibody is more threatening than the Flesh Hound and Polyp, making them the Highest priority to be eliminated between the 3.

Stuns are a good tool for shutting down the Antibody for a turn and limiting its Damage Output although due to its relatively High Stun Resist Stat it is usually better and safer to outright kill it.

Overall Threat Level: High

Templar Gladiator
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 3
Cooldowns
Body Slam - 1 rd Cooldown
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Torment
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Stinger Stab
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Body Slam
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Torment is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack that deals High Damage to both Heroes in the Front 2 Positions.

Stinger Stab is a Decently Accurate Single Target Attack usable if the Templar Gladiator is in the Front 3 Positions that deals Very High Damage to a Hero in the Back 3 Ranks in addition to applying a massive amount of Blight.

Body Slam is a Single Target Attack with a Decently High Crit Chance which is usable from any Position that deals High Damage to a Hero in the Front 3 Positions while Moving the Templar Gladiator Forward.

This Attack has a High Chance to Stun the Target Hero while also Pushing them to the Back Ranks.
Overall Analysis
The Templar Gladiator is the Non Boss Version of the Templar Impaler, having only 1 action per round and being unable to use Revelation.

It can be encountered during Third Darkest Dungeon Mission and its Stats are identical to the Templar Impaler.

The Templar Gladiator is a very threatening Enemy due to it being able to deal hefty amounts of Damage and Blight to your Heroes using its Attacks.

Thankfully, you will only encounter the Templar Gladiator by itself during the third Darkest Dungeon Mission, making it easier to handle.

Stuns are very useful for shutting down the Templar Gladiator for a turn, and Debuffs are a good way to limit its Damage Output.

While they are not able to use the threatening Revelation Skill, all 3 of its Skills can do very high amounts of Damage. Thankfully, you will only encounter the Templar Gladiator by itself outside of the Endless Harvest, making it easier to handle.

Overall Threat Level: High (In darkest Dunegon)
Very High in Endless Harvest

Templar Sniper
Darkest Dungeon
Floor 3
All Skills
1.0 Base Chance to Target Random Hero / Monster
Darkest
Torment
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Stinger Shot
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Doomsday
1.0 Base Chance to be used
Skill Breakdown
Torment is a Decently Accurate AoE Attack that deals High Damage to both Heroes in the Front 2 Positions.

Stinger Shot is a High Accuracy Single Target Attack usable from the Back 2 Ranks that has a Very High Crit Chance and deals Very High Damage to a Hero in the Back 3 Ranks in addition to applying a hefty amount of Blight.

This Attack can also inflict a hefty Debuff to the Hero's Damage and Crit Chance.

Doomsday is a High Accuracy AoE Attack usable from the Back 2 Ranks that deals Decent Damage and Blight to all of your Heroes.
Overall Analysis
The Templar Sniper is the Non Boss Version of the Templar Warlord, having only 1 action per round and being unable to use Revelation. It can be encountered during Third Darkest Dungeon Mission and its Stats are identical to the Templar Warlord.

The Templar Sniper is very threatening with it being able to deal hefty amounts of Damage and Blight to your Heroes using its Attacks.

Thankfully, you will only encounter the Templar Sniper by itself during the third Darkest Dungeon Mission, in which case the Templar Sniper can only use Torment, making it much easier to handle

Stuns are very useful for shutting down the Templar Sniper for a turn, and Debuffs are a good way to limit its Damage Output.

Overall Threat Level: Medium High (In Darkest Dungeon)
Very High in Endless Harvest

Scourge of the Warrens
The Flesh
Squirming, Contorting, and Ever Expanding. This Horror Must Be Unmade!

The Ancestor's zeal for blood rituals and summoning rites had begun to ebb, as each attempt invariably brought only failure and disappointment. Progress was halting, and the rapidly accumulating surplus of wasted flesh had become burdensome.

He was unable to store such a prodigious amount of offal, nor was it possible for him to rid of it easily due to it being possessed by unnameable things from outer spheres.

However, When excavations beneath the manor broke through into an ancient network of aqueducts and tunnels, the Ancestor realized he had found a solution to the problem of disposal.

The spasmodically squirming, braying, and snorting half-corpses were heaped each upon the other, until at last the Ancestor was rid of them.

However, due to this the Warrens had become a landfill of snout and hoof, gristle and bone - a mountainous, twitching mass of misshapen flesh, fusing itself together in the darkness..

The Flesh is a boss comprised of 4 enemies that share a single HP pool, and have attacks that can pack a punch with Stuns and Damage Over Time which can prove to be deadly. They are also aided by having a good bit of RNG during the battle.

All Flesh Parts but the Heart are quite durable with the lowest PROT value being 30% and the highest reaching a whopping 90%.

At the start of every round, each part has a chance to change to a random body part with some restrictions (Heads must be at front, Butts at back)

One thing to note is that with the boss' main Damage Dealing skills, they can be played around due to 'Maws of Life' only hitting the front 2 ranks and 'Undulating Invasion' only being able to target the back positions.

Considering the fact that many of the Flesh Parts have hefty PROT numbers, Bleeds and Blights - preferrably Area of Effect are highly desirable, with Heroes such as the Plague Doctor and Flagellant.

The Shieldbreaker is also a good choice due to having Armor Piercing damage in 'Pierce' and a full cleave that can apply Blight.

Due to the Flesh having a tendency to focus down a Hero, Guards are preferrable as a safety measure with the Houndmaster being the more desirable of the 2 Guarders due to having 'Hound's Harry', a full cleave with Bleeds.

Mark Based Damage can be viable if you are lucky and the Flesh rolls many Flesh's Hearts, but due to it being RNG based there are better alternatives.

Eldritch
